I can't wait to see what's to come of future developments. 
Thanks a million for such a creative application!!

Now... let’s address the sound! Wow! I can’t believe the amazing audio system I have in my home now. When I thought Bose had it wrapped up outcomes Sonos and steals the show. The highs are crisp and lows boom!! There’s no shortage craftiness between the two either! Just tremendous sound that envelopes every corner of my home. I’m truly in love with the ease of use, adaptability of new additions, and the amazing ability to sample other Sonos speakers in my home and tune them all at once as if there we’re a sound tech in the airwaves orchestrating it all to perfection!!

Can’t say enough about the total package! And THANK YOU just wouldn’t do so, THANK YOU - THANK YOU - THANK YOU!!!! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼 😎

title: Skips and phasing out. BS!
text:
I used to love my Sonos. I got it 3 years ago and have recommended it to all my clients, friends, family and neighbors. I have installed them in many of their homes. 6 months ago my system started skipping. Hours with tech support 2 levels deep and no fix. They say “a new update is coming”. Then I get auto updated to this crap. 
Why would any company treat their long time product owners like trash?! As we all move and expand our living environments wouldn’t you except us to stay connected with Sonos products. With this move you are simply giving your current clients the middle finger. While also welcoming new competition into the mix to right your idiotic errors. I hope you come to your senses or fold shop on this issue. Seriously fire your executives because they are clueless about the customer experience and that matters most!
I’m so angered at this update for what it means from this once stellar company.... Ugly new logo asside.

title: Speakers are great, but...
text:
I’ve had my Sonos speakers for a few years now, and must say that I’m quite satisfied with them. Things were were going great with a very intuitive app where things flowed beautifully.....but now, not so much. 
Perhaps a transition team of programmers were installed; since the original founder left the company and a new Alexa based speaker was in the works. Could it be they wanted a fresh interface to go with it’s next generation? Well, the new team must not have had a good grounding in the app that previously ran things very well and produced an app that is non-intuitive and takes more steps to accomplish things. Hopefully, after reading the complaints in their Sonos forum, they will be able to whip things back into a smooth running app. I’m hopeful.

title: Great system, crummy app after recent update
text:
Updated review:
The updated app interface is horrible. It is difficult to find how to link my Sonos into a single zone and how to select which streaming service I want to use. It is not intuitive at all. And it's not just because I'm used to using the older version. Please revise this as soon as possible after you've let the current group of designers go. The hardware still rocks, but the app now gets a BIG THUMBS DOWN.

Over time I have purchased Sonos for each room in my house and I love the versatility the system offers. The app is great allowing for playback from multiple different streaming sites (e.g. Pandora), from a songs on a mobile device like an iPhone, and from a library on a NAS or PC/Mac. Really great App.

title: Worked well but...Pandora is now sketchy
text: My Sonos Play5 is almost 3 years old and I still love it’s clean and loud sound across most of the sound spectrum.  However Pandora recently has started to act up.  It basically plays the first 15 to 20 seconds, then states the network connection has dropped and then auto skips to the next song.  This is not a network connection issue and this is not a hardware issue, as the other Sonos sound sources play just fine without any interference for hours of use.  Not sure whether there is a mini Pandora app running inside the Sonos, or whether it’s the Pandora app itself on my phone....I just know it worked fine for years, and within the past month, it now skips for a while until I change the Pandora station, or change sources altogether.  The app now gets a 2 until it’s addressed and fixed.

title: LOVE my Sonos
text:
I have been a Sonos user for many years now and find their products (across the board) rather amazing on many fronts.  Ease of use and reliability are at the top of the list. Their technical support staff is also very good and given that I am also in the business of recommending & selling these products, find that very reassuring in an environment that is not always as hospitable. 

My only negative comment is the recent software update and GUI seem to have taken a step back as a relates to user-friendliness and simplicity and I wonder sometimes why companies feel the need to make changes like this.  If Wholesale changes are to be made I think the user should be given an option of retaining a previous GUI if they prefer that..:)

Great gift for the holidays !

title: Play 3 Sonos speakers
text:
The speakers are ok but they are not a true WiFi speaker. Sonos is more interested on providing a music service via their APP. They continuously update their firmware and APP interface to keep up with the latest computer and mobile technology. It all sounds good huh...

Well here is the problem. Early Sonos customers will eventually not be able to play their music from their favorite playlist or Steaming service of its not entered into an agreement with Sonos to be on their APP. Thus eventually you will end up being phased out and thus your speakers will be obsolete and of no use to you. Unless of course if you go and purchase new hardware to keep up with their firmware updates they force you to download to your device.  Every time you end up downloading a update you are gambling that your device will be able to handle it.  If not you are SOL 

They are more interested in you buying the speakers to have you locked into their Sonos APP service, where think they are Making their money. 

A true WiFi speaker will allow you to play your music from any computer or mobile device, regardless of how old your WiFi  operating and hardware systems are. 

Bottom line they are a WiFi music service and not a true WiFi speaker company that will allow you to steam music from any steaming app or music you have already purchased.

title: To call this an upgrade is a misnomer
text: This most recent iteration of the Sonos is the worst by far. I have had a Sonos since its early years and presently have 3 speakers.  The design interface in the early years was reasonable but the technology was buggy and somewhat unreliable, with intermittent download issues, but became fixed and stable with upgrades. The problems with the latest “upgrade” are manifest not at the technical level but in the woeful interface.  It’s is non intuitive and obscure to navigate, and the decision to organize stations in the only format available - in descending order or most often played - with no other alternatives available is incomprehensible.  It is hard to imagine how anyone thought the interface design decisions in this software version thought they added to the product. I do not think that very many users view this as anything other than a user friendly disaster, it simply does not give consumers what they look for in a good Ap.

title: Updated review...
text: Ok, I went back and updated this review. I had complained that I had to re-pair all of my speakers to the base station every time the Sonos App installed an update. I was so frustrated I just stopped using them because I didn’t feel like doing all the pairing again. A few days after writing my review I went back and decided I would go ahead and re-pair them all because I was missing the music... Magically, they were all paired and ready to go and I had received a developer response saying that I should never had had that problem. Well, I had had that problem many times, through several updates, so for now - I will leave it 4 at stars. The music is great, the interface is great, if they stay paired for through the next update or two I will happily update my review to 5 stars.

title: Fantastic
text:
Did a lot of research before buying Sonas Soundbar. Love the sound quality. Wanted to be able to separate sound so I could hear voices above background sound. Wanted to be able to connect to my existing Bose hard wired sound system. Wanted my wife to enjoy the same or different music in her sewing room. Meets our love for music requirements. Fantastic. No problems-found easy to set up and use. Recommend highly.

You need to update your app so that second speaker in living room goes on automatically with other speaker in living room. I find it annoying to have to turn on 1 speaker when the one in the kitchen and just one in the living room go on, but the other speaker in the living room has to be turned on manually.

title: Great hardware, mediocre software
text: While the quality of the actual speakers is first-rate and lives up the cost, the software that controls it is amateurish. Speakers regularly lose connection with the phone, don’t remember where they were before they lost connection, and can’t play unsupported content (like podcasts) without first downloading them, or not at all (the Calm app).  I would frankly sacrifice audio quality if I could have the ease and reliability of pairing my system to my phone like I would a pair of headphones. Lastly, they have inexplicably, deliberately removed lock screen control. For a premium home speaker system that can cost thousands of dollars, I would expect its reliability and user interface to be rock-solid and intuitive.

title: Music or movies nothing comes close!
text:
I have the Sonos sound system through out my house. The surrounding sound with movies, especially action movies just like the theaters, but you’re at home. There are 3 rooms that can have this movie theater effect with separate movies in my house. The difference is in each room you can watch different movies, shows or listen to your favorite music with same setting. Wether you’re watching a football game throughout the house and outside entertaining while you’re barbecuing. In the same way you and your guests can listen to music. The sound is amazing even with the Play 1 speakers, throw in a Beam or a PlayBar in the mix, and add a Sub or 2. Call it done!
Todd Adam encinitas, ca 🤙🏼

title: Shortfalls
text: Two issues, and they may be a result of my lack of expertise on the app.  If my phone is the controller (because it doesn’t come with a stand alone or tv compatible remote, (that’s actually the third issue I have, yes I want to buy a whole SONOS system (easily $3k) and than spend $250 on a “everything” compatible remote, insane)) than I should be able to be able to look at and use other applications on my phone (I.e. FB) without losing the volume control for the SONOS.  This points to my last problem.  It needs to have “smart sound” like the old Magnavox TVs.  When commercials/ads or music (in show) play it shouldn’t be blaring based on the volume required to hear conversations in shows.  These two volume related problems are making my wife want to get rid of it which would be unfortunate as it was costly and has awesome expandability caps.

title: Podcast feature not user-friendly
text: I wish the app would save your place in podcasts, that you could skip up and back 15 seconds, and that you could play it from your phone not just from the speakers. If I’m listening to a podcast and have to stop, next time I want to listen I have to find my place and some shows don’t download with a scroll-able bar thing to find your place so I have to start from the beginning again. Also, if I’m listening in the house but then move to the car or go for a walk it would be great to be able to keep listening from my phone. It’s a bummer to have to go back and forth from this app and the podcast app and find my place each time. Also, the app doesn’t have any EQ settings and sometimes I want more bass in my music. Other than the app, the speakers themselves are great. Awesome sound but nice and small. Hope these fixes to the app happen soon

title: Absolutely Love These Speakers
text:
I have received this speaker system as a gift. The sound bar, sub, play5's and play1's work together perfectly to produce excellent home theater audio and music.  Previously owned a BOSE Acoustimass system and felt the need to move into wireless to accommodate my audio needs in an upcoming move to a new home out-of-state.  Previously owned the Bowers and Wilkins A7 which is used in the den, but I am even more satisfied with the wireless capabilities and versatility that this Sonos system possesses. Easy to setup, maintains connections effortlessly, looks fantastic, even the packaging is top-shelf.  Sonos has hit this one out-of-the-park as far as I am concern!

Update:  Just added a Sonos Amp and Sonos Port to the system...love how a Sonos expands the possibilities!

title: NO WIRES
text:
Having a Sonos system in my home has been a total game changer. I used to spend hours and hours in people’s homes during construction running stereo wires throughout the house. I used to do in my own home and had multiple speaker switch boxes to accommodate the number of speakers I had. 

I have 14 Sonos speakers throughout my home and they work impeccably. Surround sound on the TV with the Sound Bar and Subwoofer is dynamic and I can listen anywhere In the house if I don’t feel like staying on the couch.  Everyone can listen to a different station or playlist in any room. It’s great for guests to choose their own music to fit their mood at any time.  

My only request is that Sonos start adding input jacks to the Sonos PlayOne and PlayThree. It just makes sense.

title: Most arrogant design ever
text: It’s infuriating to be subject to the conditions of this software, not named “controller” by chance. It DEMANDS a software update or it won’t work. Then it DEMANDS to “sign in for more features”  or it won’t work either. If I don’t comply, I can’t use it. I paid a nice amount of money for this speaker but the experience is like asking for permission to use it as if it were a leased piece of equipment. I cannot play music already stored in my iPhone because of the incompetence and/or indifference of a spoiled product manager who doesn’t think for a second on the user’s convenience. This app and product reflect the arrogance of Sonos “culture”; not even Rolex imposes such demands when service is required. Never mind, I’ll never recommend sonos products to anyone. And rest assured that I’ll hack it to use it with an aux line-in to avoid the dependency on the “controller”. Sonos: you not only lost this customer, I’ll make sure none of my friends considered it.

title: New update is very clunky
text:
In March of of 2017 I invested in a three zone Sonos system.  Connect, connect amp and a Sonos play 5. I have used it virtually everyday for 7 straight months.   

However, the most recent update (October 2017) to accommodate Alexa voice control (among other things) is vey clunky and unreliable.  Latency from app to speakers is noticeable.  Changing between rooms /zones used to be fast and seamless.  It was a breeze.  Now it is slow and unreliable.  App will display one zone as “paused” but music is playing. Also the app will not accurately display what music is playing which zone.  

Sonos - please fix the bugs.  I’m a huge fan and plan to add more zones (play 5’s), however, I’m worried that a great product has taken a step backwards with the latest update.

title: Connectivity issues with latest update
text:
Love the Sonos App and the Sonos System. I have multiple speakers and stations (15+) in a couple of properties. 

Had trouble updating some of my rooms (needed multiple tries) and could update the system to 8.5.2 in one of my Sonos One Speakers. Hence, I lost the music in one of my rooms! This is the first time this happens. I really don’t care for Alexa but it seems to be interfering with the updates... I hope Sonos fixes this issue.

Review Update: I reset the whole system, unplugged other speakers/stations, moved the problem speaker to anew place and after several tries, it updated. Still very inconvenient, especially since it is the first time this happened; so it appears to be a problem introduced by the update itself. Reviewed update from 2 to 3 stars. Next time I have a smooth system update I’ll bring it back 5 stars.

title: Endless issues: drops, skips, NO connection ?!?!
text:
The latest Sonos app update has created lots on issues: unable to connect to the  home Wi-Fi anymore, cannot find it somehow ?!?? And when Sonos manages to finally work, it starts skipping songs after songs..... it’s endless !!!! Clearing the Queue each time does NOT resolve this problem, despite being told it would fix that issue. 
Called tech support numerous times and it’s being blamed on the most recent iPhone update, which BTW, was weeks prior !!!
Getting extremely frustrated and annoyed with the Technical Support Team  constantly deflecting and differing the problems to IOS software and Apple products, instead of working on the problems and fixing it.

title: Sound Beam does not connect back to TV after listening to music.
text:
I recently purchased a Sonos speaker (specifically the Sound Beam), and I’ve been highly frustrated with it. Unsure as to whether it’s the app or the speaker itself, so I’ll orient this to the app because I think more of my issue as the app’s fault. 

Every time I listen to music from my Sonos Sound Beam, everything works perfectly fine... until I stop playing music on it and want the audio to connect back to my TV. When I want my speaker to output the TV audio, it just doesn’t output from my TV until I unplug the speaker and plug it back in. VERY inconvenient! It’s a $400 speaker that you control via the app and there is still no solution to this problem!!! I will not be buying anymore Sonos products until I’m aware that this problem is fixed! I only wish for an option to switch from music to TV audio and vice versa and it just doesn’t exist. Highly disappointed in my overpriced experience!

title: I was happy with Sonos until it forced me to give personal information
text: This recent update made it so that you MUST make a Sonos account, which didn’t used to be required. It asked me to agree to a privacy policy that I obviously was not going to accept until I read it. It collects the following data(this is directly from their website):  “Sonos collects your name, phone number, email address, shipping address, payment information, location data, IP address, social identifiers, data provided by cookies and similar technologies, functional data such as registration and system data, as well as additional usage data.” I find it appalling that a SPEAKER needs this information to be usable. It wasn’t cheap, either. I am not comfortable handing over this information, and because of that, my very expensive speaker is unusable until I agree to these ridiculous terms. Extremely disappointed with the money that I’ve wasted on a now unusable speaker.

title: Trash
text: The developers try to force you into using this app by preventing people from having access to much needed features as clearing the queue programmatically. So every time your parents come over and you tell Alexa to play your “soothing parent friendly playlist” it will inevitably be merged with everything already in your queue: yes the raunchy sex music, yes the kill everyone Metal, yes the satanic chanting. Even if you’re less extreme, you get my point. That Christmas playlist you asked google to play? Awwww cute. But no, it’s mixed in with the bad ace of base songs you were bumping while you showered. Your vibe is now officially bunk af, Christmas is ruined, and its all your fault because you’re stupid for having bought these expensive speakers. If you don’t want to be glued to your phone, or go to your laptop every time you want to change the vibe, Sonos is a gigantic waste of money. Do yourself a favor and stick with Alexa speakers.

title: Simply doesn’t work
text:
Connectivity is spotty to say the least.  We can’t get through more than two songs without our service being interrupted.  It has nothing to do with our internet because we have multiple devices connected to our WiFi that work fine.  Sonos is the only product that doesn’t work.  We actually have three different Sonos speakers and none of them work.
We’ve had multiple conversations with their customer service and we’ve tried reinstalling the speakers and reconnecting the WiFi connection, but nothing has worked.  They also suggested that there could be other microwaves interfering with our speakers, which basically means that it won’t work if you have any other products that use a WiFi, Bluetooth connection, radio, or any other type of microwaves.
It’s incredibly frustrating that they have not been able fix this problem, so I would not recommend Sonos to anyone at this point.

title: Something that I can’t ignore...
text: I’ve had my speaker for about two years. We have multiple throughout the house. However, my biggest issue is that by connecting your music account to the speaker, it gives everyone in your home access to said account. When you don’t get along with siblings and have very different music tastes, this poses a significant problem. This messes with your suggested music, your statistics, etc. If someone commandeers your music account and is playing it through their speakers, it causes problems in the music app itself, by not allowing you to play music and changing what is playing. I’m tired of seeing Rap Caviar in my recent or heavy rotation sections. I’m tired of seeing Rap and Hip Hop in my top genres. Please, if there’s a way to only connect music services to a single device, but multiple speakers, please incorporate that.

title: My own music that Iis on my phone!
text:
Why Sonos!?!
Why in the world? Why in the world would you mandate your loyal customers purchasing a third-party music service in order to hear/listen to their own music over there Sonos speakers? I can play my iTunes music on my Bose speaker at work, I can play my iTunes music on my friends speaker at his house… But no… In my own home, where I have over $1800 worth of Sonos speakers throughout, I cannot listen to my own music on my own phone. Without purchasing a third-party music service. This is beyond ridiculous and disgusting. You care more about money with a third-party music service then you care about your own loyal customers.
Very very disappointed in you Sonos. I used to brag about how great Sonos was to have at home. Now, this is the very first issue I bring up to anyone who even mentions Sonos to me. You need to change back to allowing iTunes to be played on Sonos without a third-party music service. Immediately.

title: Only one flaw
text:
I love my Sonos system. It's great for playing music that is streaming via Apple Music, and that is a lot of what I use it for. Its one flaw, and it's kind of significant, is that it won't stream podcasts. Not only is it not an option just to stream them, but the work around - downloading the podcast and then listening to it via the "on my phone" option - is extremely glitchy. Everytime I've tried to use it like this, I have to give up because it stops working. So then I switch over to a Bluetooth speaker and of course lose the ability to have what I'm listening to play in multiple rooms in my house. It's frustrating.

I wish Sonos would figure out how to stream podcasts as well as they stream music. If they ever do this, I'd give them 5 stars.

title: SONOS = Best system out there
text: Hands down. Just buy it and you'll never look back. They thought of everything 👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍 Sonos is every music lovers dream and they make it so easy to enjoy it room to room even if those in the house have different tastes or moods in the music they want to hear. Our entire house is Sonos, including the outdoor speakers by the pool that we used Sonos CONNECT to convert to be a Sonos speaker, as well as the same on our dock. Guests love that they too can play their music all throughout our home with the simple app on our phone, iPad, or even easier .. their own phone! Start with Sonos 1 or 3 and you can continue to grow from there. We’ve had Sonos for almost 4 years now and still say the same

title: Wonderful system but WiFi gaps in sound
text: I’ve had the system installed with play Bar & Subwoofer in the living room, play 3 in my office/den, play 5 in the master bedroom,  and play 1 in the kitchen and guest rooms. Everything sounds superb, the only changes I would make would be to leave the living room as is and use play 1’s in all of the other rooms except the kitchen, where I would switch out the existing Play1 for a Sonos One with Alexa. The Play 5 in our bedroom is extreme overkill for the amount of use we give it. Sound wise, everything is perfect except I get Wi-fi gaps in the music whenever I click my computer mouse while my computer is connected to the wi-fi. I have the Geek Squad coming over to see if they can remedy this and make this a 5 Star instead of a 4 Star installation.

title: Happily Surprised
text: I intended to purchase a Sonos Playbar to improve the sound quality of television and movie watching and was a little skeptical about using Sonos as a primary music system.  The Playbar was simple to install and the app was easy to use for both tuning and music selection.  Once I started playing music, I was blown away by the sound quality, range and depth. The app allows Pandora and other music suppliers as well as playlists from the iPhone.  I have since purchased the sub and two play fives and everything works amazingly well. I get great surround sound while watching movies and when listening to music, I can't help but get up and dance.  I can't say enough good things about this great system.

title: User friendliness and layout
text:
I’ve had Sonos for about 5 years spread across my home and have been a fan until the new appearance and layout of the app. It’s no longer as user friendly or easy to navigate through. Before all of my music services and sources were all in one list, along with links to my playlists with a touch of the menu button in the upper left corner. Now all of those are spread amongst several tabs on the bottom of the screen and that same menu bottom does not appear on all the different screens in the app. Seems harder to search for music while already in a playlist.

A big step backwards in user friendliness and unless I’m missing something, it’s not like any new features were added that would have needed or been optimized by the layout changes. 

A setting should be added into the app allowing the appearance to be reverted back to the previous look. If it’s not broke don’t fix it.

title: Enjoying my Christmas gift
text: We went to my wife’s Christmas party at her boss’s house and her husband had a Sonos system set up. I was very intrigued when he showed me how the system worked. The sound was deep and rich, and no matter what room you walked into you could hear the music due to the lay-out of the speakers throughout the house.  I commented to my wife how I would enjoy these speakers.  Well, She got me two speakers that Christmas and ever since my house has been filled with music. Now, when people come over and my Sonos system is on, I get the same reaction.  People love the sound playing throughout the house and it really adds to the atmosphere of the gathering.  I will definitely be adding more speakers as time goes on.

title: Invasion of privacy much?
text:
First thing I need to get out of the way is why does this app need my location? If you turn location services off, it will literally ping you to death. Why? Why does Sonos think they need to know where I or my speakers are?  

Second, it’s so slow. And again with the constant reminders to update to the new S2 controller, which I can’t use because it’s incompatible with my older - but still perfectly fine - Sonos hardware. The subtext here is, “throw away your old stuff because we made something new”, but no. 

If this was a review of the hardware, we would have a glowing waterfall of accolades, however, the controller app - which, oh, I almost forgot, stopped supporting the iTunes library on my mobile device why? - has always been the shortcoming. If there were any other way to control these speakers, I’d use it. Since there isn’t, when they finally wear out, I’ll buy AirPods.

title: This app is awful and I regret ever investing in Sonos
text: The speakers themselves sound wonderful when I can get them to work. This app is terrible. It no longer offers support for iTunes (which happened after I already invested in speakers); the app refuses to maintain a connection to my Plex server, the app will not recognize my multiple attempts to reauthorize my Plex server; when I do manage to get music to play, the app and speakers constantly lose connection even though I live in a 700sq ft apartment and have exceptional high speed internet service. No amount of updating has solved any of these issues for me. I regret ever investing in this company and technology. I’d have done better to have gone with a blue tooth speaker set. At least with blue tooth I could listen to my actual iTunes music library and the dozens of custom playlists I’ve curated over the last decade+.

title: Speaker is great, app is kinda clunky
text:
First off the speaker is fantastic. But this is a review of the app, not of the speaker.

The app is pretty bare bones. Internet radio is annoying to setup but once done it works great. Yay KEXP. The connection to Apple Music is a little awkward, especially when browsing “My Music.” It’s a far cry from app the features of the Apple Music app experience. And you’re gonna have to use the Apple Music app to do any new music or new playlist discovery, the Sonos app is basically useless for that.

Ads in an app like this make no sense to me. I paid a few hundred dollars for this speaker, and when I launch the Sonos app to play some music, I get in-app pop up ads that block the whole UI, asking me to buy more speakers? Just let me have a delightful music experience, please, I think I paid for it.

title: Has been and always will be the best product in its class
text: I used to sell and design residential systems for high end A/V, I was a Sonos evangelist (even though our profit margins were lower with this product) because I loved the product. I’m still a Sonos evangelist, it’s better than its competitors in every way; ease of use, constant updating of the user experience and the sound. Where else can you get the amazingness on the entry level for that price by the way, starting with a Play1 and moving up? I may dabble with  Heos for more affordable portable speakers, or maybe a JBL Bluetooth for camping, but I’m an avid music lover and wannabe speaker dude, for the other 96% of consumers, BUY SONOS, you won’t regret it!

title: Sonos
text:
Yes, I enjoy Sonos. I play far more of my music than I did with out it.  Yes, I would recommend it. I am playing it over the main floor of the house through Sonos speakers, Sonos connect to a Marshall speaker and sonos connect though my home stereo.  The sound is great. The connectivity is strong. I like being able to control it through my desk top (apple) and iPhone and iPad.  
I don’t like having to restart Sonos each morning to get it to play. I don’t like that it doesn’t always load the album images. I don’t like the way the controls appear on the iPad and iPhone. I don’t like the problems I occasionally have getting Sonos to recognize an album that is clearly displayed in iTunes. Still I will continue using it and continue to expect improvements in the product.

title: Sonos
text:
Much is been written about the Sonus systems audiophile qualities, where in it really has no equals in the Wi-Fi connected world.
What I am focusing on is the overall controller and User software Sonos has created and built around the system.  Having lead software projects for 20 years it is some of the best designed and executed user and controller software I’ve ever encountered.  This includes the ability of the speaker and your phone to interact  when initially setting up the system honing the speaker to our rooms acoustical fingerprint.
My only disappointment is actually with the last release where I think they missed the boat on a number of points but otherwise it’s an amazingly well constructed system.

title: Poor integration execution
text: I integrated this system with Crestron control 4 and savant. Every time there’s an update there’s issue either no control or some goofy work around that we have to figure out and show the customer. Not to mention the ridiculous amount of updates and changes to the UI. Making it impossible for the end user to figure it out. 9 times out of 10 the end user isn’t techy and get lost in the UI. Maybe you need a little rethink on the UI. And keep it simple for the simple folk. Also having to log in with a user name and password. As if people don’t have enough crap to remember. You’re already connected to the network. Why would you need a login clearly you already have the correct credentials to be there why the login. It’s stupid and a waste of time. Get it together or we will stop selling your sonos. Trust me 50% of you sales comes from custom installs.

title: Love my soundbar and subwoofer
text:
I’ve had these 2 Sonos products for approx 2 years and I’m still amazed how incredible
It sounds for being wireless. I’m NOT an audiophile by any stretch; however, for any typical average user- the sound is Siiiick. The playbar sounds incredible- it’s loud and clear. The base rattles the windows and it sounds like elephants rumbling through the house during action movies. ( bass is still less than half way turned up. I live in an average 2500 Sq foot 2 story home and you can hear and feel the base rumbling in every room. Did I say I’m amazed how awesome this is - especially being wireless?
I’m eventually going to buy more speakers but this is more than good enough for now.
I’d def buy this again. Great job Sonos.

title: Terrible forced update to a typically good product!
text: What in the world is going on at Sonos for this update to be pushed through?!?!?!  You've obviously never heard, "if it's not broke don't fix it".  I had a Sonos system installed in my new home 2 years ago and have loved everything about it until today.  First complaint, the UI went from above average to pretty bad taking major steps backwards which makes no sense at all.  Second, third and fourth complaint... ever since the forced update I get the message "could not play song due to lost connection from phone" literally every 5-10 mins.  I've never had this issue or anything like it in 2 years.  Absolutely nothing has changed on my end outside of this freaking insane update.  This obviously makes your product completely unusable for me until something is done!  Is this a joke, how can you take a perfectly good product and screw it up this bad???

title: Unable to play music stored on phone soon
text:
This app works well enough and it’s easy to get up & running with your Sonos speaker(s). I have half a dozen speakers throughout the house and the app makes it easy to control playback & volume on each of them.

I’m giving this a one star review because apparently Sonos plans to remove the ability to play music stored locally on your phone in a few months (see quote from Sonos below)—this is simply unacceptable. Being able to play music stored on your phone is such a basic, fundamental feature of any music player app that the fact that they’d even entertain the idea of removing it is laughable. Sure you can still stream music from Apple/Amazon/Spotify or your computer, but you shouldn’t be limited to those options. It would be extremely inconvenient to lose this functionality. 

Sonos should take the time to make the necessary architecture changes to keep this feature rather than simply removing it altogether.

“We first launched the 'On this iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch' feature in 2012 as an option to play locally stored audio content on Sonos. The way this feature was originally architected has become unreliable with newer versions of iOS.

In the coming months, this feature will no longer be available in the Sonos app.”

title: Used to love Sonos, but....
text:
I have 5 speakers throughout the house and I love the ability to choose what plays where. BUT, I agree with other users who are not happy with the app updates. Just like everything else on my phone, including the phone operating system, I cringe every time there is an update, and with good reason. Two updates ago everything was turned upside down. It takes me forever to find what I used find in one or two clicks. The worst part is they threaten you to update, "some functions may not be available unless you update."  Ok, ok. So I updated, now the volume control on my phone doesn't control the Sonos volume like it used to. 

And yes, for the record, I'm an old fart.

title: Now i hate my Sonos
text:
If i could rate it zero, or negative, i would.  This latest UI has rendered my Sonos essentially useless.  I will start playing on one system, and the app will lose contact with that room -play in another room, and but then you can’t change the song, or interrupt play.   You have to kill the app and restart.   Magically, it will find the original room system them.

Additionally, i find the Sonos support people arrogant and extremely unhelpful.  I’ve had the same setup for 7 years, haven’t moved wired or anything.  But, every two or so year, they change the app -and blow up my system.  Calling in, they always want to blame it on some change that I’ve done.  Miserable.

title: So many problems and no longer supporting On My iPhone
text: I use Sonos at home and office. At home it’s fine, but in the office w/multiple users on the internet (no one else using Sonos) I have so many problems it’s becoming unusable. Sonos daily is unable to find my music library on my iMac and then miraculously finds it again, Sonos app can’t find/connect to Sonos one minute then half out later it can and there’s been no internet outage, songs cut out, are skipped and stops playing so frequently that I have to turn it off so it doesn’t disturb my clients in their acupuncture sessions. Sometimes I’m able to get the iPhone app to work when the Mac app no longer connects to Sonos (and vice versa) which is why losing the On My iPhone is so frustrating for me.  I own 5 speakers but may have to scrap the system with all these instability problems and losing the On My iPhone feature.

title: Sonos app causing me to rethink future purchases....
text:
I have been holding out and saving up to add the sonos sub to my existing sonos setup. However, lately I am beginning to rethink whether or not I should continue spending money on sonos products at all due to the sonos controller app constantly “bugging” out on me. 
The biggest issue I keep running into is that the app takes forever to connect to the system once I have already started playing something. Lately however, it just flat out refuses to change to the music I am requesting. Super frustrating!! Being that the sonos controller app is the ONLY way to play music through my very expensive sonos speakers is quite alarming to say the least. I am definitely holding onto my $700 that I was about to drop on the sub to see if sonos fixes these obvious mistakes on their part. Unfortunately I won’t be able to hold my money for long before I decide to go with a different brand.....

title: Unbelievably Incompetent App
text: Sonos makes good speakers, and their wireless connectivity is impressive. The controller app, however, is the most incompetent piece of junk I can think of in recent memory. Every night, without fail, my wife and I have to stumble through the app in order to change the freakin station. I can’t imagine what these developers are thinking?? We are tech-savvy folk, and struggle over and over again to figure out how to change the radio station? Just bizarre. Clearly a case of the people being most familiar with the app (the developers) being completely and totally unaware of the user experience. Why not gather some people in a room and see what questions they ask when using the app? We can’t be the only people having a hard time changing the channel. This should be so easy a dog could do it. Come on Sonos! Your controller has been this bad for years now. And you still haven’t figured this out? Wow.

title: Too many flaws to enjoy
text:
It seems like every other day there’s an issue with Sonos. One day it’s cutting in and out (which turned out to be that I’m not allowed to enable a 5ghz option on my wireless, even if I don’t use it for Sonos!)

The other day it just won’t start.

But all days, and which is super annoying and can’t use, my (2) Play 1’s are out of sync with my Connect causing a very disturbing sound delay between the different rooms.  My wife hates it, saying there’s always something wrong with it - and it’s really disappointing when you spend money on tech and it doesn’t work. 

Tried every suggestion, (unplug everything, let the router restart, plug everything in one by one, assign specific WiFi channels, make sure there is no processing on my receiver. Etc etc etc etc) maybe there’s another suggestion I haven’t heard yet? 

I purchased this technology in order for it to be easier to play music in my apartment and it’s only been worse.  When I ONLY play the (2) Play 1’s it works 95% of the time - but they sound “ok” - but compared to my separate setup they are terrible.

title: Multi Versatile and Expandable
text: We have Sonos speakers in almost every room in our home, with the latest addition of a pair of “Play” speakers to our outside covered Patio. Under normal conditions, the sound is wonderful but felt it would not suit a Poolside BBQ party. I took two other speakers and the subwoofer from the other rooms, plug and play, configured via the app, and in less then 10 minutes bolstered the patio sound system into a more richer sound experience. We and our guests enjoyed the acoustics thoroughly (don’t know about our neighbors.) The next morning, put the speakers back to their original locations as easily as they were relocated. We absolutely think Sonos has wonderful products.

title: Disappointed in App, NOT Speaker
text:
The speakers are amazing and I have no complaints about them. My problem is with the app. 

The app works well, but the main problem for me is that it doesn’t allow me to play my own music on my phone that I purchased. I have to have an Apple Music subscription to be able to play my music, which I don’t think is right. If there is a way to play my own music without having to subscribe to Apple Music, it is not an easy user-friendly way (at least no way to do it on the mobile app). When I first downloaded this app, I was able to play my own music, but since the most recent update, I have not. What is the point of purchasing my own music and expensive speakers if I can’t even play the music I bought?

title: Sonos - Used to be Best Value
text:
Below is my post from 1 1/2 years ago.  However the value diminishes because you cannot play all of your downloaded music on Sonos due to Digital Rights Management issues.  Why?   Your simply using Sonos speakers to play the music you purchased.  Sonos points fingers and blames others.  That's B.S. As they are really just a sound system.  

Other thank that, they are great per below.  

Sonos is the best value for the quality. You would have to spend significant dollars with a high-end system to realize any significant gain in performance.  The app and controls are second to none. FYI - You can sync via their app to the most common music storage accounts such as iTunes, etc. 

Summary is best explained via compare and contrast of another technology that is similar in cost breakdown. Do you know optics such as binoculars, scopes, etc.? If you do, you know Leupold is the best value mid range up to the low high-end with a fair price. You have to spend $2k or more to realize the best with Swvorski type products. Same here. 

And get the 5 position speakers. You will be much happier.

title: Sonos just gets worse and worse
text:
I have used sonos for years since 2009 at my buddies house. Finally got my own pair in 2011. Now? I have playbar, sub, two amps, 3 play 5s and 3 play 3s. Spent hundreds over years on easy and a fun to use system. With the recent app changes, right around the time they went to a white background, the ease of use for the app went down the drain. It is plain horrible. My apps on diff laptops/tablets/phones are not in sync at all. It’s been so bad the past few months, I am now actively shopping for a new whole house solution. And what’s worse? I work at a national retailer and stopped recommending sonos to customers. 

Sonos, stop being complicated and get back to an easy to use interface. “Use sonos from Pandora” ummm no one cares. We use pandora in sonos. Whoever is pushing new ideas to you isn’t very smart of your millions of users out here. We don’t need new blue jeans; our pair worked just fine. Thank you.

title: Wifi Compatibility
text: The amount of times I’ve had to try to reconnect my Sonos because it couldn’t be found on my WiFi is beyond frustrating. It has been set up and working before both through my TV and just playing music, but after a week it always comes up with a “We can’t find Sonos” prompting me to try other options EVEN WHILE PLAYING MUSIC. I really like the quality of these products, but the issues are so aggravating that I had to write a review. I live in an apartment complex with building WiFi but I have my own router to connect to and tech support tried to get it sorted out. In the end, they told me they couldn’t do anything more because they didn’t know where the router was connected. If you’re making a home sound system, why would you not also make it work in apartments? It doesn’t make any sense to me and now my system is basically worthless until I move into a house.

title: Gen 1 speakers fell off network / 11.0
text: I have a ConnectAmp and 2 1st generation Play 5’s. After the 11.0 update, the Play 5’s fell off the network and I cannot reconnect them. I’ve tried all the methods in the app to add them back. The speakers aren’t creating a SONOS network like the app says. I’ve directly reconnected a speaker to the router and it works then (both Play 5’s connect), but when I remove the Ethernet connection, both Play 5’s fall back off. the network. I’m fearing this is the foreshadowing of troubles to come with Sonos’ attempt to get newer and legacy products working in the same home. I love Sonos, but I need my products to work. Was considering the Playbase.

title: Poor Integration
text:
Extremely frustrated to find that some of my existing speakers will not work on the new application basically making them obsolete should I decide to continue to grow my speaker system.  It was my intent to have my husband buy me the new sound bar for Christmas but when found out I would have to switch to the new app and lose 2 of my existing speakers I said forget it.   Such a scam to choose to design an application that weeds out older speakers and force people to buy new when they are working just fine.  At this price point I expected to buy once and have them for years. 
And the fact that you still can’t figure out how to integrate with all music streaming services to have access to all of the features- it’s been 2 years and I still can’t listen to the online only extra channels through my sonos

title: Hours Of Frustration?
text:
I have had 2 Sonos Play:1s and a Sonos Playbar.  Yes they are old.  For a long time the app just worked - a little fussy as to the network and the connections made to the WiFi and then the devices.  With the latest round of updates to the Controller - wow.  No devices, and a 30 minute “time waster” (per speaker) as you go back and forth trying to factor reset it and then get it to “recover” into a network mode where it will be recognized.  In the end you have to get the speaker factory reset - Ethernet doesn’t work you have to set up the device’s network, connect, and then configure it.

I would have called it a day and said “once every 2 years you can waste the time” - but then Playbar that I fixed last weekend is now not working.  Nothing is working - all the devices disappeared....
Nice!

title: Can’t play music from iPhone
text:
This is the first review I have ever written. I don’t care if it’s unreliable.  That’s better then nothing.  I have two Sonos connects attached to a whole home music system (HTD Home Valet).  They both worked fine with the new iPhones. Since Sonos in there infinite wisdom decided to change the app, you can no longer play music from your iPhone to your Sonos equipment.  I use Alexa to start my home valet and Sonos app.  I don’t carry my Mac or pc around the house with me. I carry my phone and play music throughout the house to speakers in every room.
Most people use their phone for music. I believe Sonos needs to fix this problem

title: Updates are rough
text: Speaker updates happen too often with minimal payoff. Currently, when I try to install, the update stalls, crashes, and does not update all my speakers. Then when I restart the update, it performs the update on the same speakers first, and then stalls and crashes. Eventually, after repeating this process several times the speakers will update and the update message will stop popping up for a week or so until the next update gets pushed down, and the process starts all over. The app is also changing and moving stuff around and getting more convoluted. I used and enjoyed the older version of the app much more than the current version.

title: Was great
text:
I have enjoyed my trouble free Sonos system for the first two years until they started to update everything. For the last five plus years lots of problems. The main problem is at least once a month the whole thing crashes and I have to re-start every speaker (5) which is frustrating. Constantly getting “Can’t find a Sonos system” or “There is no Wi-Fi network” yet the speakers are playing music over my Wi-Fi network but can’t access via the controller (smart phone, iPad or computer). Solution: Restart the bridge, restart the router which results in having to restart each speaker. Sometimes just turning off/on the Wi-Fi setting on my phone is the fix and that might be required two or three time a month. 
Customer service is good but what I want is my seven year old trouble free system back!! Very frustrating!!
John K.

title: Integration with Pandora is awful
text:
Ever since the upgrade The Sonos app has been unreliable..stops music when I didn’t stop the music. Pandora works..for about 20 min and then it stops. Doesn’t matter if I start music in Sonos app or in Pandora. And I really prefer to use Sonos app to play my music. I don’t like opening Pandora to play music. If I decide to play something else, I have to stop Pandora, then open Sonos app to play music from my music library. I also find the layout of the Sonos app not intuitive. The previous version was better.
I waited a while to write this review hoping Sonos would correct these problems. Nothing has changed. 
I will say...the music quality is incredible. My guests always comment on the quality of sound and look for big speakers. They are shocked when I show them the small speakers producing amazing sound.

title: What happened to the user experience?
text: I’ve been trying... but with the recent updates to the user interface, I’m constantly finding myself clicking the wrong thing... the older version had a more top down design where the room you were controlling was at the top and the music you wanted to play in that room was below that.  They seem to have shifted to a more bottom up design... but even then it’s not very clear.  Very disappointed with this latest release - I hope they do some usability testing on their app and clean some things up - I really can’t believe I’m the only person that thinks this (I’ve heard it from a few friends as well)...

title: Just Gets Worse
text: I bought my Sonos a few years ago and absolutely loved it.  However, the App updates (some forced) have slowly whittled away at the functionality of the system to where now I would warn everyone to stay away from this product.  SPOILER—you will not have the freedom and/or flexibility to play all your music library from your products that you own.  Sonos and Apple will point fingers at each other but I honestly don’t give a flip.  I bought a product that performed a function and now that functionality has been forcibly removed post-purchase.  You’re better off just sticking with a standard Bluetooth or even wired speakers instead of Sonos’ proprietary system.  Bluetooth won’t sound quite as good but the upside is it won’t lose functionality or keep crashing due to poor/buggy App design. And you’ll save a ton of money!

title: Decent.
text: It’s a good system when you want to throw on some playlists from the internet here and there. However I’ve had an issue with Sonos for a while now. I like to play my own iTunes playlists that I import onto my iPhone because it’s exactly the music I like to hear. But when I play any of my personal playlists through the sonos app, a song could play for a minute, 30 seconds, or 15 seconds before cutting off and going to the next song. It’s super frustrating because I have to eventually resort to putting on a pandora playlist or something. This issue has occurred on two separate phones I’ve had the app on, as well as being present through multiple sonos app updates. Not sure what the issue is, but it’s made me reluctant to use the system often.

title: Gold Standard
text:
Bedeviled by ear fatigue for way too long in our master bedroom, we started looking hard at the Sonos One for relief. Wow! Just what the doctor ordered. Silky, smooth audio streams delivered with the right power and the right clarity. And a no fuss, paint-by-numbers setup helped the medicine go down that much easier.

After hearing the first one, we doubled the dose for double the pleasure ... in stereo. Couldn’t order the second Sonos One fast enough.  The system ties to all our devices, including Apple TV, and connects to a slew of content. 

We have a 10 year old, 40” Samsung flatscreen, and adding stereo sound with this level of fidelity made for nothing less than a transformative moment. Stunning sound with even highs and heavy distortion-free bass. The Sonos One represents our first foray into the world of Alexa. And so far, so good. Ripping our old Samsung sound bar off the wall never felt so good. 

Crystal clear WiFi stereo - that streams as smoothly as it sounds - is just the therapy our tired ears needed. You really can listen as well as you hear — with a speaker at least as good as a Sonos.

title: USED TO WORK GREAT
text:
When I first purchased the system 5 years ago it worked great,
However, with every Sonos update it has become worse and worse to the point of being unusable most of the time. It is a shame with the amount of money I spent on the system to see it fail do to poor software. Sonos has taken a great product and turned it into junk. I no longer recommend it to others do to its poor performance. Sonos should concentrate on its products and not on being on the stock exchange. As with many company’s that have gotten bigger they loose sight of what got them their a good product which Sonos no longer has plus poor support for it also.

title: You win...
text:
I'm lazy when it comes to rating apps good or bad. My thought is I either like it and use it or it's stinks and I'm done with it. This is an amazing app for an amazing product. I will say I am simply rating it because they have finally beaten me into submission with their constant requests. Of course this only happens when you use the product so much. Therefore, they have every right to ask me if I like it, get a good rating, and have others buy their product based on that - I get it. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. 
9/4/17 The app would be SOOO much better if it would recognize I have already rated it and STOP asking me to rate it AGAIN and AGAIN and AGAIN...

title: It just keeps getting worse, not better
text:
Dear Sonos,
In this new release I guess you are responding to marketing research and customer feedback in your development process. There appears to be a problem though: The segments of your customer base you are turning to for insight are apparently customers who spent about ten minutes a week with Sonos, using a two zone system.
The rest of us? We'll be over here in the corner flailing around with this new app-thing you demanded we download. I like white space as much as the next graphic designer, but feel free to use some of that space for, oh, the buttons and controls people need to manipulate all the time rather then burying elements in weird places!
I've got a dozen zones and tens of thousands of tracks, and your app is getting LESS useful, not MORE.
Your apps, especially for computers, were super easy to use.  I say "were" because I can't currently use the one on my desktop workstation since you demanded I update that software which won't actually update because gosh, I don't feel like dicking with upgrading the entire operating system on my computer just so that my little Sonos remote control thingie can run.
And for the cherry on top, you still can't give us a scene/presets function that actual customers have been requesting for years and years.

title: Used to be a great app, now its a complex program..
text:
Ive been using SONOS for many years. Its great to see that over the years there were small tweaks that made the UI/UX better. I took part in the beta group as well, but realised the focus moved to expanding offering vs improving the current experience. All good though.
This latest update however, is an epic fail. Confusing, contra intuitive. Going away from the minimalist design and ease of use. The iPad version is now worse as it is a clear small form factor UI design, while the previous design added ease of use for larger screen formats.
No improvements have been made in features and true impactful design (why is a great feature like cross fade still hidden behind multiple clicks).
Change for change is a bad habit. SONOS, stay true to what made you great: make music easily consumable by anybody at any time.

title: So many frequent buggy updates
text: I've had this system for quite some time, approximately 7-8 years.  Every update I always hesitate and try to postpone because most often the system will stop working properly and will take significant work or another update to fix. The most recent update once again has thrown everything out of whack and now every time I open the app it can’t find the system and asks for me to add a speaker or any component to get working. BUT HEAR THIS, once this is fixed, it works for about 5 minutes and then it no longer is paired and music stops. All of a sudden I need to start all over again!!! Help!!

title: Product good, interface with phone not
text: The Playbar, two Play Ones and Subwoofer in our family room sound pretty good.  The collapse of the ability to play Apple Music easily off of my phone is seriously disappointing.  I understand that perhaps I could buy two new Play Ones, that I can send to through Apple Play.  But my existing ones are only a couple of years old.  Why doesn’t my brand new Playbar allow me to connect this way?  Currently we cannot play any music off of our phones through Sonos. That pretty much makes the whole system obsolete.  Finally, yes, I’m modestly techie, and will find some workaround, but the rest of my family just wants to play music from their phones through Sonos.  At the moment, as far as I can see, that has become impossible.

title: UNSATISFACTORY!!
text:
I just spent several thousand dollars to get our first Sonos products. I bought a whole-home system including two Playbars, multiple Sonos One’s, a Sonos Beam, etc. I should have done more research on the freaking app. It is the most confounding, confusing, cuss-worthy, useless app I have ever attempted to learn. 

I’m a competent tech person...not an expert by any means...but I learn and navigate all apps without assistance. Not this one, though. It is frustrating beyond belief. It is the WORST!

At first I appreciated the app’s clean look. That lasted until I needed to troubleshoot our system which happened at breakneck speed. Then I realized how very little explanation and help screens there really are. What is there is overly-simplified and the most basic of instructions. I will have to call our A/V professionals back out because apparently sharing useful information on this app is too much to ask. 

Even as I’m typing this, my husband is screaming he cannot get sound from the TV on a Playbar using the app. My husband is beyond frustrated and I am so regretting I didn’t check out these reviews to see all the unhappy customers complaining about this version of the Sonos app before I spent all the money on the hardware.

I never write app reviews but this one deserves a great big ZERO out of five stars. **UNSATISFACTORY**

title: New Update makes Sonos unusable
text: The new update is brutal to use. I’m a professional AV installer and have installed hundreds of Sonos pieces. Our phones have been ringing off the hook on requests of how to use the app. Customers aside, I have Sonos at home. My wife who is far from technical used to love Sonos, she now has gone back to using her phone for music. I find my self constantly thinking about how to choose music, when to swipe down or up. I accidentally group rooms and play music in areas I forgot about that were previously selected. The old app made everything easy, I never had to think about it. I have clients that aren’t technical and they had it down in under 30 seconds. This takes 5-10 minutes of teaching now. Until Sonos gets this under control we have ceased selling it and are actively looking for alternatives. So far Music Cast and Heos are the best options for this debacle.

title: Latest update robs you of ability to play music off phone
text:
This is the most regressive, unnecessary update I have ever seen in an app and if I knew it was coming I never would have purchased these speakers. Several weeks back Sonos started warning me that I would no longer be able to play music off my phone because it would be “unstable”
 I NEVER had any issues playing music off my phone until they started these warnings. I spent a lot of money and time downloading music and creating playlists on my phone and now they are worthless as far as this speaker system is concerned. I guess a I am too old for this system as I see no need to pay to subscribe to a music service (and the related cell streaming costs) to use speakers I have paid hundreds of dollars for. FIND ANOTHER SPEAKER SYSTEM that does not sell out to online music services!

title: Cannot get app to access speaker
text: Super difficult to get the app to work with the speaker. They tried to do a “1 size fits all” app for all models. It doesn’t work. If you change to a different WiFi, which you’re likely to do if you move or want to take the portable speaker on a trip, it’s impossible to set up the speaker again using the app. You go through many steps which may sort-of work depending on the step. However, now that I reinstalled the app for the second time just because I changed to a new WiFi twice, the app window isn’t large enough to show the “continue” button for me to be able to move forward with a new setup (4th or 5th time now having to set it up). So. I’m stuck. The instructions online say you have to connect to the network Sonos is on to connect with your speaker. That network is long gone at a house I haven’t lived in for 4 months.

title: Fantastic
text: I have purchased many a wireless speaker in my day,  this by far is the most exceptional!  It truly is so easy to connect and to pair to the app it's almost too good to be true. But it is! It's also just as effortless to connect multiple speakers to one Group or to remove a speaker from a group with ease. The sound that comes out is phenomenal after purchasing just won three months later I have five and considering getting the sound bar for a television. Nice job Sonos nice job!  PS I also like the option of being able to connect to my Pandora or listen to music on my phone without actually interrupting any services on my phone phenomenal!!!!

title: Required updates
text: Why not provide an update that supports the wireless modem we use?  Every time you send an update it requires us to physically  connect the Sonos  bar to the modem and the subwoofer as well.  I am now told to get a booster which I have never had to consider before.  Why not provide a fix?  Your technical support is outstanding but every time I see an update I dread the process. May consider another brand of sound bar.  Our sound bar in vacation works perfectly fine.   We are required to use the modem we have due to the block of condos and  internet provided thru our association.  I need a fix.

title: Sonos iPhone Controller
text:
Time to find a new music system. I have been loyal to Sonos before u could use phones to control it. The updates bricked my original expensive controllers. Now I can't use an old iPhone because. Sonos and Apple seem to think that u must have most up-to-date phone to select music! I'm done with my Sonos system...I hear Google has a system...

Above was my response regarding Sonos controllers. I do like the overall system, but wish the app would have a more direct way to use the equalizer and balance controls. I have a room with two distinct listening positions, and it is a pain to change these settings when needed.

title: Software Shenanigans!
text: I'm a long term owner of 3 play 1's and 3 play 5's and now I have 2 phones, a tablet and an iPod that cannot operate them as the IOS is outdated for Sonos software.  I'm sorry but all of these devises operated the speakers when I bought them so there should be no reason I have to buy additional devises to operate a SPEAKER!  While the sound is great, I find the idea of going back to a receiver w/ speakers and a cord to use my phone and tablets a better move and throw Sonos' away. JUNK!  Who alienates their customers in such a way? When you buy a TV, car, etc. you are not required to keep buying additional products to operate them.  What is next?  Older Sonos speakers that will not operate with the latest software?  I can see that day coming, mark my words. That is not what I bought into and is not in the CUSTOMER'S best interest, right? Don't buy these and get sucked into their business model!!

title: Sonos Interface is TERRIBLE!!!
text: I have to say that when I bought into the whole SONOS system, I loved the App interface. Sure, it had some odd things about it, but for the most part it was super intuitive to understand and operate. Well, SONOS recently pushed an update to their App ... and (IMHO) the interface is unnecessarily complicated to use.  And it certainly isn’t intuitive to use. The layout and overall functionality just doesn’t make sense anymore; a sharp contrast to the previous version. If I hadn’t invested so much money already on the actual hardware, I would chose a different Wi-Fi speaker system other than SONOS based solely on their App interface.

title: Nice when it works
text: I had my Sonos play for 2 years, set up was tedious but fairly easy but the Sonos app is very inconsistent. There will be days when it works as expected but other days it is impossible to play anything through the speakers. The most common problems include not finding the sonos speaker, not able to connect to networks and not able to browse music, these problems occur even when your internet/wifi connection is working well. In addition, changing to a new modem/router is a very painful process due to the large variety of errors that one can and will encounter during the process, specially if Sonos is working with Alexa. Finally remember the inherit limitations of the systems... only can play music through the sonos App or Alexa and connectivity is limited to ethernet and WiFi (no Bluetooth, no jack connector). Despite the software/app is lousy when it works it is a nice speaker.

title: Very unreliable and frustrating
text: This system seems to get worse every year. It is not uncommon to have speakers drop out midway through a song. Today I fired up the system in my bedroom, the bedroom was now unknown to the player. After adding those speakers back in the system froze 5 minutes later, the app eventually crashed and when I restarted the bedroom was again unknown. When I bought Sonos (about 9 years ago) it was known as the system that ‘just worked’. Those days are long gone. I have spent way too much time with Sonos support (very nice folk) changing network parameters - blah blah blah. I am sick and tired of turning on my system and having to spend 15 minutes getting it back on the air. Perhaps it all started when Sonos switched to standard WIFI instead of their bridge, I don’t know. I’m almost at the end of my rope here.

title: Skips and Stops - Wasted $3800
text:
Whether playing from WiFi or directly through an aux cable into the five it skips through every song and after a few songs it stops. It doesn’t matter whether it’s playing from a computer or a phone the same issues persist even music saved into the system. Only through a music service this doesn’t happen. The Aleksa app has very limited functionality and is really misrepresented. The help desk simply says well it doesn’t do those capabilities. Well then it’s not Aleksa. 

As far as the help line they open a case and close it in two days if they don’t hear back. They should realize if someone spends $3800 on their system perhaps they’re busy and can’t reply that quickly. 

Save your money and aggravation and set up a Bluetooth system. Anything is better than this. The sound is good but if it skips every thirty seconds who cares.

title: Used to be simple.
text:
I agree with what a lot have said.  This app used to be easy to use, now it’s far less user friendly.

I have I have a boost, play speakers and subs in multiple rooms of my house.  I’d love to use them, but when I try to select a room and a music source, the app ignores the room I’ve selected and plays in the previously selected room.  The new room selection menus are terrible in the first place.

The app now constantly cuts songs off mid-play and moves to the next one when I try to play on my iPhone, regardless of whether I have the songs downloaded to my phone or if they are being streamed.  I’m tired of singing along to bits of songs.

title: Wonderful - Love it!!!
text: When working on new ceilings in our home we had a choice of wired surround sound, outdoor speakers, etc. when trying to find all the components for this complex setup we happened onto Sonos, husband was skeptical about the wireless sound so we started with connect amp for the wired patio speakers and a Play 5 for kitchen/family room. We were so impressed with the ease of setup and sound he was convinced and we bought Play bar, sub woofer and 2 play 1's. We are very happy customers website was great with new internet providers found what I needed to set it up, speaker quit working Sonos was able to troubleshoot found defective new one sent within a week!

title: Three steps backwards, it is not what it used to be!!
text: The old Sonos app, controller and connections were flawless - I could keep music streaming literally for months on end without any connection or zone dropout problems whatsoever (we have 9 zones).  The new ‘upgrades’ ... aren’t upgrades.  Rather, they are downgrades.  There is no useful added functionality, in fact navigating around in the app is not nearly as intuitive and it takes more clicks than before, and the system drops out zones quite often now.  I never had this problem before.  Now I generally have to reconnect zones every day or every other day. Unfortunately, in the interest of presenting something new and fresh they took many steps backwards!  I used to rave about Sonos to anyone who would listen, saying things like, “it just works, flawlessly”.  I no longer rave or say that - because it now doesn’t work flawlessly.

title: Even more dissappointing
text:
Update!! No now audible works, but what about podcasts. I’m in the middle of any random podcasts and mid song, sentence, beat the podcast hard stops and another one begins without warning or a request from me!!!! WHF maaaaaaan, apparently this is an existing issue that hasn’t been addressed. I spent way to much on a system to have much of what I listened to (podcasts) stop mid stream and jump to the. Get it together sonos.   

I bought two play 1s and a sound bar only to find out that audible can’t be streamed via Sonos and that podcasts stop and start willy nilly. Sooooo disappointing, especially after having spent so much money. 

Buyer beware.

title: For Premium Price There Shouldn’t Still Be Connectivity issues
text: I have the play at and two play ones for a surround sound configuration. I have had the system going on two years. They are great speakers! Here comes the but, when they are working properly they are really great. Connectivity to the app from iOS is horrendous and has been since I’ve owned the system. Constantly does not load and I have a beast of a wireless network. I have had these speakers in 3 different setups now and still the same issues. Connectivity to the app and also connectivity to the playones are a constant let down when they will not connect. For a 1200 dollar system this should not be the case with years of time to fix issues as well. Moving on to klipsch wireless.

title: App needs improvement
text: The sound of the Sonos speaker is amazing, zero regrets there. However, app needs a lot of improvement. I’m a music/podcast addict. Wherever I am, I’m most likely listening to something on my phone, but I can’t listen to something through the sonos app and pick it up in the exact same spot when I’m on the go. I have to open another app and start over, there is poor integration across apps. I also have to download everything to my phone as it doesn’t connect to my iCloud. I’ve also found that often sonos will randomly stop playing a podcast I’m listening to, and it will force me start at the beginning, causing me to lose my spot. Hoping the app improves as this is the number one reason I have yet to recommend sonos to my friends.

title: Custom A/V integrator
text:
The major change a few months ago to your App has not been well received.  I have played with it for months now and it is still confusing and no longer intuitive.  Our customers are all quite disappointed with this change.  I am sure at this point you have heard this from a great many of your customers yourselves.  I wanted to know if you were planning a major redo anytime soon.  Now with products from Denon, Blue Sound, Anthem and many more, our customers are requesting some of those instead.  We prefer to sell Sonos because it has the most relationships out there in the music App world, but lately the customers are giving us a lot of push back.  We do many homes that have anywhere from 12-24 zones of Sonos (and not your portable speakers).  We are talking about Connects to large amps, killer speakers and unbelievable outdoor systems that have the neighbors asking what kind of system they have.
Anyway, let me know if there may be a change soon, so I can at least tell the clients that it will be changed soon since it wasn't well received.  A company that responds to their customers is one that builds trust and confidence with loyal following.

Sincerely,
Guy Pratola
Design consultant at PAC.

title: Great System, App is Downfall
text: I’ve had Sonos for years and still believe it’s the best option on the market for what is offered... BUT, the Sonos app has been experiencing a slow and embarrassing fall from greatness over the last year or so. Elegant and easy processes are now clumsy and bulky (ex: changing group audio rooms, the existence of multiple (...) menus, being forced to confirm the speakers I want to play music on when I click Play (a la Clippy: “Looks like you’re trying to play music, click more buttons and we’ll get on that.”), etc.), and new bugs surface with every update (ex: SXM track info not updating, like/dislike buttons not correctly reflecting votes for several services, etc.). Sonos, your app User Experience is a blemish on an otherwise stellar ecosystem of products and offerings.

title: Wildly inconvenient
text:
The app won't remember set-ups. If you use speakers in anything but one set up- there are at least 11 steps in the app to get it going. Every time I turn it on ( including Netflix pausing too long) open the app, hit speakers, hit group, select the speakers, hit done, hit the source, hit the volume slider, select the individual sliders or mute, hit drop down, select source, play, (okay, I exaggerated, it's only 10) 
Also, the play bar is center left and right all together, and doesn't allow for discrete use of "play one"s etc, as left and right. That is to say, you can't get true 5.1 sound no matter how many speakers you buy. Also, there are glitches/ drop-outs on remote speakers. 
Has promise, most of my complaints are with the app; they were very nice on the 1-1/2 hour  call needed to change from one router to another.

title: Disaster
text:
After thousands of dollars invested in Sonos products, over years, a few weeks ago all of my devices disappeared from my app. I’ve now spent hours reseting them and adding back all my services. However, now I can’t get several of the previously working ones to connect over WiFi. Also, I can’t add networks under the “network” settings.

Diagnostic messages? Those are for idiots apparently. Sonos is so much smarter than everyone else that their bespoke network setup process must be the best. Never mind that their method requires you to put the devices on the same network as your phone- despite that being a bad security practice for years now.

So frustrated and livid with Sonos right now. I even accepted their recent BS effort to force you to upgrade. But basically destroying my entire system with a software update... So unimpressed.

title: Just okay
text: The sound system is pretty great, but I’m not impressed with the app at all. With iTunes/Apple Music playlists, it frequently skips songs and skips from song to song mid-song, making the app on Apple TV the only way to enjoy this music through the Sonos speakers. Additionally, it plays Pandora well, and provides functionality to like and dislike, etc. The problem is that each time I try to use these features, a pop-up tells me the functionality has failed. Finally, there is no prompt when it’s time to update (and seemingly no automatic update option), however, all functionality (sometimes including the ability to control volume via the tv remote) goes out the window sometimes when an update is due.

title: Music to my ears
text: Sonos is the complete home sound system for those who love music but don’t want to be bothered with complicated systems.  Sonos provides hi-fi audio, with easy set up and tuning.
