The mesh network makes it super easy to add new speakers and bring music to differ rooms within the house.  I’ve been a customer for over 4 years and continue to add to my collection.  Just added the sound bar and sub-woofer ... watching movies at home just got a little more amazing.  I tell everyone I know Sonos is the way to go.  From the quality of their Products, to their amazing beta program, this company understands audiophiles.  Very satisfied with my investment over the years!

title: Hate the "Improved" App
text:
I used to really like the app until the redesign Sonos did in 2017.  The interface used to be much more intuitive. The buttons at the bottom of the screen were a terrible idea that should be scrapped. But the worst thing is the update procedure. Every time Sonos drops an update,  I dutifully hit "update" and wait while the app does is thing. After it tells  me the app is now up to date, it immediately notifies me once again that it's not up to date. Every. Single. Time. And certain functions are not available until you do the update.

Sonos makes a great product, but its app is unworthy of the rest of the technology.

title: Sounds good, but...
text:
The Sonos system sounds great and is super convenient. The app is just OK. Search functionality is hit or miss. I don’t know why you have to pick whether you want artist, song, or album etc. (you don’t  when you search for a song in google... in google you can enter anything, even a few lyrics, and find the song) and the spelling with Sonos search has to be just right. The Sonos app is also just not intuitive. I use it every day, and it still takes me a bunch of clicks to find the current queue. In conclusion: good, not great.

Also, performance with Pandora is completely unreliable, and the solution that Sonos recommends involves unplugging and resetting all of your devices. This might sound OK if you have one, but I have nine. Their software is just buggy.

title: Problems with playlists
text:
The playlists on my phone don’t show up in the app. Some playlists don’t exist and other playlists omit songs. I have on 3 separate occasions tried to trouble shoot this, we even installed on my computer and same problem.  A very large disappointment

In response to their comment:
It doesn’t explain my problem. I have an iPhone X and all of my 4K songs are downliaded via I cloud match to my iPhone.  However my playlists don’t load. For instance my frank Sanatra playlist will not even show up even though it is his album that I just bought from Apple. I even stream it from my computer and it doesn’t work. Playlists don’t show up. I have had one of ur specialists remote into my laptop and install sonos app on my Mac book pro and import my playlists from iTunes and still they could not fix the issue. This also occurred with my iPhone 6 & 7.

title: Love it
text: I had Sonos set up in my house towards the end of a remodeling project. I ended up having it connected to newly installed ceiling speakers in two rooms, to existing surround speaker system in another room, and with a Sonos speaker in a bedroom. I am amazed by both versatility and convenience of being able to play music (the same or different stations/lists) on any combination of rooms at once. Very impressed with quality of Sonos speaker that sits on bureau. I'm not tech savvy, but find I have easy access to Pandora, radio stations from around the world, and iTunes playlists. I look forward to buying another speaker for outdoor use when I can splurge on that!

title: Pointless UI changes... again
text:
I don’t get why they insist on “redesigning” the controller every few versions just to screw with us. This update is a huge step backward. Now it takes at least 4 taps just to play music. Why can’t I see more than a few stations on my favorites if it’s on an infinite scroller? Why do. I have to click see all to get to them? Why can’t I rearrange them so it’s not always alphabetical if you only let me see a few stations at a time? Why does the edit stations only show me 8 of my 23 sonos favorites? Why do the tiles have to be so big on a retina iPad? Use the real estate effectively. Why do I have to slide the list of speakers up and down to see them all in center column on the iPad? There nothing but blank bright white space on the rest of the screen. 

Give my the last version UI back, or better yet think about the UI before changing it “just because.”

title: Addition of Libby and support for multiple accounts is a blessing
text:
The recent addition of support for Libby and support for multiple accounts (e.g. I can listen to my book on Audible/Libby while making dinner, and then my wife can listen to her book in the living room on a different account) has made this a godsend in a time where we’ve been spending a lot more time in our home.

Would love to see support for changing playback speed on Audible/Libby. Right now, it feels like everything is playing at such a sluggish pace. Would love the ability to speed it up to 1.25x or 1.75x speed.

title: Frustrating update after frustrating update
text:
I’ve been waiting for years to write this. Bottom line, it’s Sunday, I just want to listen to music with my wife. But no. I need yet another update. This time it’s asking me to find a WiFi network named Sonos. Yet there is none. Now I’m stuck. 
It’s asking me to use an Ethernet cable to- no. Stop. 
Don’t buy Sonos. Don’t use Sonos. After this I’m going back to wired. Not worthy he hassle. 
I’m using a play at and the S1 app. Music and breakfast has turned into a half hour of trouble shooting. 
Nothing is worth this much hassle. I’m done with Sonos forever. Just glad I had this revelation before my friend considered purchasing a Sonos system and talked them out of it. He now has a wired set up and guess what? It’s works when he wants it to. Total garbage.

title: So difficult to use
text:
Pause a streaming show for more than about five minutes, it reverts to initial settings, (which are completely arbitrary). Every single time you go to use it, you have to go deep into the app just to get any basic set-up. It takes about 10-12 keystrokes across 4-5 screens to get to any set-up, let alone back to where you were last time you used it. There is no memory or presets , like “movie” or “workout” or “kitchen” you have to it up every tome you go to use it.... Really maddening.(and seemingly easy to fix). title: Love SONOS, but the app needs work.
text:
So let me say that I love my SONOS system and wouldn’t trade it for anything. This app, however has some issues that have been ongoing and need to be resolved.

title: Sonos system is GREAT - Latest iOS app update restored my confidence

title: Troubleshooting

title: Not for the occasional user, but OK system
text:
Background: I was gifted a couple speakers and bought a couple. 

The good: It’s decent sounding; it’s simple to set up and I think the controller/app is simple. 

The so-so: it is wi-fi and 110v based so if you have spotty wi-fi (although rare) or if the power goes out (rarer still) you can’t use.

Mostly this is ok, but about 25% of the time I get caught I an update, or a doesn’t immediately recognize system, or something that takes me 10 minutes to navigate before listening. title: New update renders Sonos almost unusable

title: Great system, terrible UI update
text:
I’ve been a Sonos user for ten years, so I clearly love the system. It seems that the good reviews are from new users and about the quality of the speakers. The speakers are fantastic and if you haven’t been a long time user, you might not realize that this update is a real step back for the UI of Sonos.

The new workflows for getting anything done are very unintuitive and less efficient than they used to be.

To give a user case, consider putting music on in Bedroom while you are listening to music in Living Room. You need at least 5 touches!
- tap the disclosure triangle on the Now playing screen to reveal the lower menu bar
- tap Rooms in the menu bar
- tap Bedroom
- tap Browse or My Sonos in the menu bar
- select your music, which will take at least one tap

This kind of workflow was effortless in the old app taking just a few taps.

This is just one example; other longtime users have written about other issues with the new app. I hope Sonos reads these reviews and reassesses the decisions they have made in order to regain the simplicity and efficiency of the old version.

As for me, I’ll be going through the rather extreme step of rolling back my iPhone backup to get back to the old version of Sonos.

title: Speakers are great, app is terrible
text:

title: Lack of Support for Legacy Products
text:

Those older products happened to be mainly the ones that required a Sonos amp and used built-in third party speakers. 

Sonos was trying to push consumers to their newer all-in-one amp/speaker combinations. We do have several of those, and they work fine. However, we really resented them forcing an upgrade on us.

You only have to look at Sonos’ website to note they are charging a premium price for their products. At these prices, you should be able to expect 15-20 year product life in my view.

Sonos eventually caved to angry consumer demand last year, but the app has started to get VERY balky with the first generation products. I’m not techy enough to figure it out in fact, but it certainly feels that the first generation products are being slowly neglected.

If we weren’t so invested in Sonos already or we had to start fresh, we would not go with Sonos.

title: Playback compatibility needs more
text:
It shouldn’t be as convoluted to simply play the music from your phone’s music library.  If there’s an easier way, I haven’t found it, and haven’t been able to successfully do it at all.  Sonos’s need to stream data by preloading content is fine, except when that seems to supersede the ability to simply play a song from your phone’s library as a direct Airplay method.  
I assumed it wouldn’t - nay, couldn’t possibly - be that difficult.  But any tutorial or posting online supposed to help make that happen has not been successful with my iPhone XR and new Sonos system.  If I can figure it out, great! But until then it is an example of the need for an improved intuitive design of the software.

title: Bait and switch.
text: I spent well over a thousand dollars on a sound bar, sub, and three sonos play:1 speakers. Sound quality is good, but they have taken away the ability to play music stored on my phone or iPad. They originally advertised AirPlay compatibility was coming, only to later bring out new speakers with that function. Mine do not have the computing power to do it, they say (only three years old). I have tried to keep my old version of the sonos app to hold onto the direct play function, but now they have even disabled my version of the app until I upgrade — to the version that does not play directly from my phone/iPad. I have to buy at least one of their newer speakers, which I otherwise don’t need, to get airplay. False advertising. Poor customer support and appreciation. One star.

title: Learning curve but we do love!
text: The interface between iTunes (which is where our entire library lives) and the sonos system is a small education. Customer support is always helpful. If you are a mac user...which we are...you will also have to decide who's library sonos should access and when in use your computer/laptop/tablet hard drive must not be asleep when you want to play music. Always room for improvement. 4 stars.  But as it goes with the current world we live in, there isn't just one system in the house to deal with these days...(nest, Alexa etc just to name a few)

title: Perfect Sound Management
text: We opened a Yoga Studio in a 127 year old building with 14 foot ceilings, so we have an echo. We needed a sound system, so my husband researched them and bought the Sonos. We couldn’t be happier. The system was easy to install, the sound is brilliant, clear and consistent. We added a Shure headset and they work seamlessly together. My husband has since added outside speakers to use during festivals and events in our downtown; perfect for MCing parades and other activities. We will be adding another system when we open our gym next door this Fall. Very happy with the purchase. Highly recommend.

title: Poor app & company
text:
Sonos sees $$$ when it sees its loyal customers: not content with having made legacy our relatively new equipment, Sonos now forces ads for products as app pop-ups, and urges upon us Sonos radio, which no one wanted and which monetizes us. I might let these complaints go in a review that concerns the app not the company, if only the app weren’t so poor.

Legacy bugs bequeathed to us by Sonos: 1) When saving a queue, Sonos gives an error message that Sonos is unable to save the queue, yet the queue has been saved; (2) setting an alarm “unable to save alarm” appears, but the new alarm has been saved; (3) sleep timer frequently takes several attempts before it registers; (4) and, likewise with the group option for which speakers to run — often some of the rooms must be turned on more than once.

title: Great speakers, terrible app
text:
The Sonos controller has always been a disappointment, and now it's become an irritant. 

I wear hearing aids, and i must keep Bluetooth turned off on my iPhone and iPad at all times, or the hearing aids will interact with the devices in undesirable ways.

The latest version of Sonos controller asks me every single time i open it or even call up the opened app to connect to Bluetooth. This is extremely annoying.  

I tried all of the fixes suggested: downloading the app new from the App Store. That didn't work. Turning on Bluetooth is not an option. 

I can't leave Bluetooth on. 

It's a shame that the usefulness of the Sonos controller has been degraded, needlesslessly, in this way. There are not even any Bluetooth devices in my house that Sonos can use, so what is the point of this intrusion?

Sonos should fix this bug immediately. It is pointlessly irritating.

The pathetic limitations of the app remain as frustrating. the tiny chip limits your playlists to 999 somgs. You can't add more than one song at a time to the playlist. No way to know what playlist is playing. Half the time Sonos can't even find the library. 

It's a shame, such good speakers, such a garbage app!

title: STOP UPDATING EVERY WEEK!!
text: SONOS listen to your d@&m customers! You leave many of us behind with incessant and obsessive updating which eventually renders our phones inoperable with our SONOS systems. Either provide backward compatibility or die because it is unsustainable to keep expecting that we will ditch our phones for new ones because we can no longer update our operating system just so we can listen to music on your devices. It’s rather unfortunate because we actually like the quality of your hardware. We hate your software and will, in the future, replace them with a company that thinks about long-term sustainability. It’s not hard to do if you are truly good at developing software.

title: Unrivaled streaming meets unparalleled sound
text: The app features real audio tuning to help make the most of your Sonos system. I have the top of the line sound bar with the subwoofer and my neighbors can’t hate me more. It’s high fidelity system paired with my huge iTunes library is the easiest combo I’ve dealt with. Best part, Everyone here at home can use their own device to use it when I’m not blasting my tunes. Definitely please my audiophile ears and look forward to expanding my system since it’s so easy to add more Sonos speakers and create the harmonic environment I need. Great app great product. Bose is loosing sleep over these guys for sure.

title: Update issue
text:
When updating to 8.3.1 the app asks me to open Sonos in the App Store to get the update, and when I do that the only option is to open the app (no update option), which loops me back to the app, which of course asks me to open Sonos in the App Store in order to update...

Follow up review: Sonos responded to this review within a day with a suggested fix. When I opened my Sonos app to try out the fix, the update had mysteriously and automatically occurred and all was well. So while I still don’t know what the problem was, it all worked out. The point of this follow up is to note that the company was responsive to my issue, so I’m happy to upgrade the review rating.

title: New to Sonos - loving it!
text:
We recently installed a 5-speaker Sonos system using Sonos One speakers in different rooms. We are pleased with the quality of the sound, the voice assistant, and the ease of use. 

I have used AirPlay speakers in the past and am used to them cutting out, getting out of sync with each other, and being slow to respond. I wasn’t sure what to expect from Sonos, but it works perfectly, without any of those issues, and is a lot of fun.

The app has been great and works well. I use it daily and have never had any issues. Most of our music streams from our Apple Music subscription.

title: Needs work
text:
First off. The most irritating thing is that it has me in a circle telling me I need to update my controller. Which I’ve already done. Then it tells me it can’t update the system until the controller is updated. It’s already the latest version of controller. This is maddening. 

Next the controller is just not laid out very well, especially when it comes to adjusting audio preferences and EQ. Why can’t it be in one spot?  Why do I have to go to two separate places to make any audio adjustment. 

Now about adjustments. Can their not be anyway to limit the highs and lows like a night mode or spoken word. I find myself chasing the volume up and down to get clear voice then blown out during high intensity scenes. If these things were addressed the app would be much better.

title: Thousands in value, low in cost.
text:
The mobile app is fine, but the system beneath is fantastic. The software provides capabilities that if bought as separate components could cost $10,000. A good example is the music library server. A good media server would cost $6,000. With Sonos, you plug an external drive into your router and Sonos does the rest. Control from computer or mobile. Instant full featured media server. 

Sonos now supports almost every premium music service and Internet Radio. Add a Sonos Connect and you can add any legacy component like a tuner or turntable and instantly they join the system. 

Sonos is more than slightly over priced on their speakers. But you have to hear the Play 5 to believe how much quality comes from a small modern Sonos speaker. 

My change  from 70s components to Sonos was a sound move. My only complaint is the lack of an ability to stream from my Sonos Network to my iPhone then I could listen to Sonos library via my Bose headphones while working in the yard.

title: Switching rooms is a nightmare now
text:
Just try it, I’m so frustrated that I can’t elaborate on it beyond that it BARELY works now ... previous version was simple - pick a room and pick your music.  For whatever reason this version cannot interpret that I want to leave the song currently playing in the living room alone and setup new music in the kitchen.

This cuts to the very heart of Sonos value prop - music in every room.  Now I just have music in some rooms while I manage my sources and oops I had to turn everything off cause I can’t switch on the fly... sorry guys one sec I swear the music is coming back.

Fix it.

title: Player interface needs work
text: Overall, this app has a good interface, which is why I didn’t give it a one star review. It’s intuitive and easy to navigate. However, the player interface and experience is pretty bad. There’s no jump forward/back ~10 second buttons like every other modern player. This issue is complicated by the fact that it’s incredibly hard to pan through a podcast since the scrubber handle is so small and in some instances not even present. This is made even more annoying by the fact that 100% of the time, it stops playing a podcast somewhere in the middle and resets to the beginning. I’ve been waiting for them to fix this, but it’s been in this state for at least a couple years, so I’m not very hopeful.

title: Update ruined interface...
text:
Update: February 2018:  Looks the revised app is the source of all bad review but it remains.  Wondering if Developer will respond and advise if there is a plan to return to a ln intuitive and functional app and address the clear dissatisfaction with current version. 

What were you thinking with the new interface, Sonos?  The idea is get more user-friendly and intuitive, not less.  Agree with other reviewers.  The changes to the interface are a confusing mess.  I thought I lost some of my favorites but then realize Sonos changed the interface so that you scroll side to side instead of up and down. (FYI:  people prefer to scroll up and down and that is more intuitive).  Love the equipment and the capabilities, but new interface makes you have to work just to play music.  Return to what was working Sonos!!!!

title: Recent update a step back
text: I have been a big supporter of Sonos and their app for 5 years.  This most recent update that modified the user interface is a BIG step back IMO.  Room selection in much different and, in my view, doesn’t work properly requiring several attempts to select the room I would like to control.  The change to check boxes is very annoying.  Not sure why the change was made but the previous approach wasn’t broken so... why the change.  I have no issues with sound quality etc but the app team needs to think about the ability and willingness of the audience to accommodate big changes to the interface. Three stars for sound. Zero for user simplicity.

title: Sonos 1
text: My husband got this for me as an early Christmas present, and I absolutely love it! My sister in law has one in her kitchen, and I love how she always has nice music playing. She told me she had a Sonos. We ordered that day. Set up was easy! I have been listening to Christmas music ever since! The piano is so clear that you think someone is actually playing live in the house! We have it in the doorway of the kitchen and living room, and it’s more than powerful enough to send sound into those rooms fully and even pleasantly all the way to the bedrooms! You will absolutely love it! I am just using it with Pandora!

title: Disappointing since the apple disconnect
text:
We got this system for our house and loved it because we could also play music that was on our iPhone library. Then about six months after spending all that money, they changed their app and now our iPhone music library is no longer available to play.   It has been mostly a disappointment since. The rep says they can sell us more stuff to make it work with our owned music, but we already feel a bit ripped off by their release of updated equipment making the old equipment not have this feature anymore with the current app.

Beware, it’s not what it was promised to be and they have not made it right despite our inquiries

title: Wanted commercial free music
text: Sad to see so many bad reviews from people who’ve used your product for years. I always heard Sonos was “the best” and got my One for Christmas. I put it on my list thinking that this compact, updated speaker would allow me to easily Bluetooth any music wherever I wanted it. Alas, the quickest way to get music through the app is browsing your channels. But uninterrupted music is my goal, and there are hardly any ‘stations’ playing without any interruptions. Note: description should also mention this when you fix. Sound is great and I love the Sleep Timer. However being wakened with the sudden jolt of a person talking after drifting off takes away from that. Definitely room for improvement!

title: Disappointed
text: I lament the loss of the ability to stream music and podcasts from my iPhone through my Sonos.  Why would a feature need to be deleted when it functioned perfectly well?  Consumers should expect a music system to be durable and enduring.  I cannot say I will invest in a Sonos product in the future- especially now with their recent declaration to cease support of older product lines.  One does not expect their other appliances (televisions, refrigerators, other durable goods) to lose functionality after five years. High end music equipment should never be marketed as such, then lose functionality based upon the whims of an IT department genius or marketing guru.  This has resulted in great loss of consumer confidence and I will not recommend this product to any of my friends.

title: Incessant updates
text:
I have a Sonos Playbar, two Sonos Connects, a Play 3, a Connect Amp, and two CR 200 controllers. So I am pretty invested in the Sonos ecosystem. I just wish that Sonos was invested in the customer experience as I am invested in their offerings.  

After the last update, my iOS 9.x iPad no longer works. Sonos decided to deprecate older iOS devices that were working perfectly before the update. It would have been good to better advertise the downside- but that’s water over the bridge. I’m sure the CR 200’s will be next.

Does the system work well? Yes, absolutely. The Playbar after Trueplay tuning sounds big and beautiful with very clear vocals that are critical for a great movie experience. 

The app is easy to use and fairly intuitive. Integration with streaming music services is quite good.

The Sonos forums are filled with nasty trolls who believe great Sonos is the penultimate digital music system and won’t tolerate and criticism or a view that there are better sounding systems out there. So good luck with that, Sonos has done nothing to reign them in. That said, they are helpful if you run into trouble with your setup.

title: Inconsistently connects to WiFi
text: I have two separate systems in two houses. When Sonos works, it is awesome to be able to access many different types of streaming; however, I find that the controller app doesn't always connect to the system (returns an error message saying "Sonos is not available" along with troubleshooting advice). It happens at both of my properties, which seems to eliminate the variables specific to one setup. After two or three attempts of closing and reopening the app, it will magically start working again. I've done the recommended troubleshooting and it has never helped.

title: Communication issues
text:
While I’m quite happy with my Sonos hardware, the iPhone app leaves a lot to be desired. All too frequently, when I’m streaming music that is resident on my phone, there is WiFi interference (I guess) and the music stops. That’s not so bad, but when play resumes, the app has skipped ahead - usually by several tracks - instead of resuming from the point at which comms was momentarily lost. This is simply unacceptable and infuriating. I spent my entire career as a software engineer and can’t imagine why sane behavior would be impossible.

The only response I’ve gotten from Sonos support thus far is to request that I submit diagnostics when this happens. But my issue is not that comms is lost, it’s what the app does in response.

title: Good all-around music app
text: I started using Sonos when its only job was to play music residing on a local computer drive. When it began to evolve to include music services like Pandora and podcasts, there were some growing pains: most notably slow performance and occasional crashes. Those bugs have been largely resolved, and this app has become as near to a complete music experience as one could expect. My rating six months ago wavered between two and three for the two reasons noted above; the most recent updates have elevated my rating to a solid four, closing in on five if the stability continues and Sonos manages to put a pleasantly surprising cherry on top.

title: Pandora
text: I love the ability to play variety songs I do not have in my library. They have everything you want for Christmas songs, Christian music, country from current, past, and bluegrass, golden oldies, jazz, easy listening, music for today, music only, etc. I also like the fact you can thumbs up and they will find additional similar music or thumbs down and not hear those songs again. You can make your own play lists, use thumbs up songs, Go to sleep with music for various time settings, or wake up to loud music or sounds. Very versatile & user friendly. 💕🙌

title: New interface is a fail.
text: We’ve heavily invested in Sonos in our home...yes even the ridiculously priced  bass speaker.  My family has been happy with Sonos app until this new redesign.  Who thought this made sense?  Takes me more time to just navigate the app than to just close it and pull up my Apple Music and listen through my phone, which lately I’ve been doing when I don’t have the care to figure out this clunky interface.  It takes around 8 touches of the app to even bring up what I want to listen to. So many steps before I can even get a song to play, and forget trying to change the music. Please keep it simple Sonos.   My family all said they can’t stand navigating through this either and my husband leads a large UI group in a Fortune 500 company!

title: Sonos = antiquated
text: I liked it at first but there are all kinds of issues with connectivity and setting up multiple speakers. Each time I have a move and fortunately there have not been many but it requires a phone call to customer support. Customer support doesn’t know the system thoroughly enough to really offer helpful solutions. Not to worry they escalated my issue and assured me one of their texts would be reaching out to me. I am still sitting in a situation where the system isn’t working properly after spending $1000 on it. With Apple and other such technology walking you easily through set up and solution Sonos really needs to step up their game. I would not recommend this system to my friends but would encourage them to look into better options.

title: Frank ‘the happy audiophile’
text: Well Sonos doesn’t need another positive review but it’s impossible not to say something good about the experience you get with such an easy to navigate app and rich sound coming from their very well made speakers, I have so many Plays of any size, Connects, Playbar and Connect Amp all over the house that I never miss a tune no matter where I am in the house, either working at the garage or just relaxing in the rear patio. SONOS I tip my hat off to your amazing pioneer company, thank you for a great and reliable product that brings so much joy to me and my family. Keep up the excellent work! 👍🏼👏🏼🧡

title: Things work now.  Sorry for the previous rant.
text:
Before the upgrade, I loved Sonos.  I had recommended Sonos to everyone.  My only complaints were that I thought the controls could have been more intuitive, e.g., I’d like all options on the same screen (playlist, song currently playing, rooms, crossfade, shuffle).  

Now, however, the issues are more elemental.  The bugs in the update display the wrong song that’s playing and the wrong rooms where it’s playing.  And you can’t fix it!

C’mon developers.  Go back to the former version until you can make the update work correctly.

title: Constant mandatory updates that prevent full use of app
text: Somos issues near-constant app updates. I wouldn’t mind, except they often prevent adding new music from your library and changing various important settings until you update. Oh, and at least once I couldn’t update sonos until I updated my entire Mac OS. Why Sonos feels compelled to disable important functions because your app is one day behind the current version is beyond me. And needing to update Mac OS (several hour process) to use your stereo is frustrating. People buy Sonos to replace their old stereo. The difference is, when you turned your stereo on, it played. Sonos wants a fifteen minute to several hour time commitment before you can play your music.

title: Want to buy more but I’m scared
text: I have thousands of dollars in SONOS product. I want to buy more however after learning that they are not supporting older product I’m holding back. This is not an iPhone this is a system that I have built my home around, considering the investment I have made I just want to know that I’ll be able to play music for the next ten years...  I have friends who are still in love with 20 year old speakers... I wish I could say the same for my SONOS or will I wake up one day and realize I have no sound system....

title: New Update is Terrible
text: I’ve had Sonos speakers for a few years and now have a total of 8 speakers, in my home as well as at my business. I used to LOVE using my Sonos system and the app interface was simple and so user friendly. The new interface is confusing and quite frankly doesn’t make any sense! It’s difficult to navigate through the app. I had Sonos at home prior to putting speakers at my business. Now I wish I had never put them at the business. It’s nothing short of embarrassing. The speakers cut in and out all day long now (I’ve tested my WiFi and that’s not the issue), and my staff can’t even figure out how to use the app anymore. I never had one negative thing to say about Sonos until this update happened! Please go back to your old ways! Simplicity and reliability is what made this brand so great to begin with!

title: Interface gets worse with every update!
text: When I first purchased my Sonos System I was pleased with the simple easy to use interface. With each update since it has been more and more difficult to both use and find what I’m looking for. I don’t want to fight with the app, stop obscuring functionality with needless large icons and splash screens that require swiping to actually get to what should be right in front of me. Now when I open the app I’m presented with a screen that requires me to swipe down if I want to do anything other then play what I was previously listening to, problem is more often then not I end up with the Apple notifications screen instead of the features I want in the app. Why make the simple complicated????

title: Good controller
text:
App makes it easy to navigate and access my music collection and online music services to play on Sonos devices. This controller is not meant to be the primary application for organizing your music. It does not, for example, allow you to rate individual tracks or automatically create smart playlists. It doesn't recommend music. Sonos continues to improve the app so that it takes fewer steps to get the music playing.
Most of the reviews I've read here comment on the overall Sonos system, and not on the app itself. I've used Sonos for over 12 years. The overall stability has declined, but the controller has only continued to improve.

title: Love it, could use some extra features
text: In the year ive had the Sonos Play bar and Sub, I think the only time it wasnt playing music only was when the power went out once. Great sound system for the house for young people to play their music and have a good time. At the same time, depending on song or TV input im always changing the Bass level, which takes quite a few menues to get to. All I would like is some way to put Bass and Treble adjusters much quicker to get to from the album cover of the song or aound thats playing.

title: Major disappointment to loyal customer
text:
I have two systems and recommended another to a family member. The issues is below in italics and the fix is not a real fix.

iOS devices which causes audio interruptions when you have non-Sonos AirPlay devices on your network and your iOS device goes to sleep. We're investigating the issue, but for now you can get the streaming going again by disabling AirPlay on any non-Sonos devices in your home, or by disabling auto lock in your iOS device's settings menu under display & brightness. Another option is to sync your phone's storage with a computer, and stream from a music share. 

This is absolutely terrible, an important customer is currently suffering because they are an Apple household, music being streamed from an iPhone was randomly stopping in the middle of a track and skipping to the next track during a party - Very embarrassing for our client. This problem never existed before

WHAT IS GOING ON SONOS !? - BY NOW THIS PROBLEM SHOULD HAVE BEEN RESOLVED ! 

How do you expect people to switch-off auto-lock on their iPhones when it compromises privacy ? How can an Apple household go to every iDevice just to switch-off AirPlay before they can play music

title: Please fix
text: I have been a Sonos user for over 4 years now & been extremely happy until this new update. Based on reviews I’ve read I’m not the only one. Clearly Sonos realized they stepped in it and had to build an a few updates in a very short timeframe. The most current update renders the app completely unusable. I have to use my laptop now to control all my different speakers. The app simply refuses to let me switch between speakers, extremely irritating!  I’ve shut the app off, restarted my phone etc & still unable to toggle speakers. The last update had a 25% success rate at toggling between but this one is a 100% failure. Sonos please fix

title: Please add Apple Watch functionality
text:
I’ve been a Sonos fan for years. Ease of use and great sound quality are the reasons I have expanded my Sonos setup over the years

Two things I would love to see in the future (though one seems easier than the other):
Please add Apple Watch functionality. It would be helpful to play the Next track while working out in my home gym (where my phone isn’t necessarily handy) or adjust the volume on the Sonos Bar while watching TV. If one or two touches could give me access to the most important functions, it would really enhance the overall experience. 

The other request is more complicated. I would LOVE it if Sonos integrated a mesh network into its speakers similar to Google Nest. That would encourage me to further expand my Sonos network and I wouldn’t need to have to have two systems. If the Sonos One could simultaneously play great music and extend my wifi network, I would have one in every room of my house.

title: Best Music Purchase Ever
text: I always have music playing in the background and until we discovered Sonos, that meant we had to have a radio or CD player in every room. Now we have placed Sonos speakers in every room including the patio and pool house and we can wander from place to place without losing the sound. If we don’t want music in a particular area we can shut it off for that room simply by using the Sonos app and unchecking that room. If I want music and he wants sports we can direct different options to different speakers. Sonos has made easier and the sound quality is excellent.

title: Recent Update Causing Issues
text: As a Sonos ambassador and owner for >4 years, I’m extremely disappointed with the new update. My family and I ALL own Sonos (15-20 speakers). I am unable to connect 1 of my play ones... We have 7 speakers connected just fine, but our 8th is not. I’ve tried everything the website suggests and nothing is working.... I am extremely advanced when it comes to setting things like this up and fixing connectivity issues. Nothing is working at this point. I’d call support, but every time I do it’s a 30 min wait time. Extremely disappointed with the new update. I’ve spent at least 2 hours connecting each speaker to the router, updating one by one, restarting network, factory reset etc... Nothing is working. It took me 10 resets to re-connect my sub (connected by chance...~45 min).

title: A good start but full of bugs
text:
Why is it that when I set a zone to play a shuffled playlist, every day when I return to play that zone it starts over at the first track?  It should remember where it left off.  

I’m also not a fan of queue based shuffling... why not just have it pick a random track every time rather than making users hit a shuffle button and wait for a 3000+ tack playlist to SLOWLY randomize.  Picking a random number after each track finishes is much faster and would prevent the issue where returning to a “random” playlist has the same tracks in the same order every time, and always starts at track 1 rather than where you left off.  

This player is a HORRIBLE user experience.  And based on how slow your company moves I’m sure it’ll not be address for 3 or 4 years....

title: What an awesome system!
text:
We recently right-sized and replaced our stereo/home theatre systems throughout our house with a Sonos system. I am thoroughly pleased with how well the system works, the wifi connectivity, the lack of massive tangles of cables, the effectiveness of the app in controlling the system and the flexibility of the system are truly awesome.
UPDATE  We still love our Sonos System, but I’m not too enamored with the new app. It seems so much more difficult to work with when compared to the older version. I’m sure I’ll get used to it and learn the nuances, but it’s not nearly as intuitive as before.

title: Pretty good
text:
I use the app these days mostly for streaming SiriusXM radio. 

The app works reliably when it comes to playing music from this service. That is, except for displaying the correct artist and song/album name, where that information is often out of sync with the music, sometimes displaying information from a song played several prior to the one actually being played. 

This same problem occurs on three different recent vintage iPhones we have in our family, as well as a Samsung tablet, which tells me the issue may not be with the app. But, nonetheless, it needs to be addressed.

The app works very well for controlling our Sonos equipment. It does have some shortcomings, though. For instance, it lacks any controls to pause, skip backward/forward. The SiriusXM app for the iPad/iPhone does have these controls, but the app can only be used for playing music on that device. 

For these reasons, I took away 1 star from an otherwise very good app. I would definitely recommend this app.

title: Iterating on wrong features
text:
I'm reducing the testing to 2 stars so that maybe devs see it. I post in user forums, but these comments are wiped after each beta. 

I hate the refresh of the home screen on each load because the app is too stupid to cache the "most recent" albums it just fetched a second ago. I hate the search results using and listing rarely used services first. I hate the unnecessary prompt for which rooms to play music on when you hit play on an album, even though the answer is always the same ones I'm playing the current content on. I could go on and on. Sonos, you're iterating on the wrong things.

title: Sonos - more like so-so
text: Sound is VERY lack luster for what I paid.  Wireless is a nice idea, but I Hate the delays in accessing controls from my phone.  I’ve read sound Improves if I invest in a sub woofer and more speakers, but at $700 a piece, I’m super hesitant to invest.  If the sound from the get-go was price appropriate, I’d have no problem investing in more, but it’s dubious at best.  Also, getting the sound bar to play my music is so hard that I have yet to figure it out. Thought it would be easy for anyone’s device to “hop on” and DJ” but it’s not.  That doesn’t help. But frankly, the sound is so unimpressive I’m not in a big hurry to figure it out, because my home stereo (Harman Kardon) blows it away.  Overall it’s just expensive for what it is.

title: New software is driving me crazy!!
text:
I wrote the review below a year ago. Then I rated Sonos 5 stars. I still love Sonos, but the new software is quirky. I often can’t choose a new station or play in two different rooms like I used to. Fix the software and it’ll go back up to 5 stars. 
We started with the wireless network a stereo and a mono player. We just added 2 more players. They're practically effortless to set up, controlled from phone, iPad, computer, can group the units or play different things on every player. The sound is rich, full and bass is well balanced. We can control it all from any number of devices, usually from our iPhones effortlessly. We're hoping to add a couple more speakers this year.

title: Could be better
text:
I was very hopeful with this MAJOR investment but I’m a bit disappointed in the functionality of this app. 

I purchased 2 sonos one’s a play bar and subwoofer. There are times with the sound that it will only play on the play bar even though I previously set it for surround sound. 

The app routinely seems to have a delay between when I click the room for surround sound and actual sound coming on. (The delay is very slight but a delay nonetheless). 

I called sonos customer service and they said the going in and out is due to a different MH’s used when it serves as a surround sound vice grouping. In essence what I purchased the system for with matching play ones (because you can not do surround sound without matching speakers) is an either or choice. 

Either forsake the ability to play different music in different rooms on different speakers or use my system as a surround sound and not play different music on different speakers without each time disconnecting and reconnecting as a group

title: Great hardware; the software is WRETCHED
text: If I could find a third-party software to use to connect to my speakers, I would. I loathe this software. It seems like every other update forces me to fiddle with my integrations. The most recent update - this renamed app that apparently allows them to cut bait on hardware products that they sold me a mere 3 years ago - has left my Play 1 speakers completely offline. I have gone so far as to factory reset the speakers and try to reconnect them to my network that way. They won’t authenticate, and I’m guessing it’s because my network requires WPA2, or maybe because it’s 5G. Either way, my sound system is dead, but not as dead as my relationship with SONOS. After 3 years of dealing with their buggy software, I’m going to consider this a $400 lesson learned.

title: Every Room Sound!
text: I’ve been using SONOS products for a few years. Over the course of time I’ve outfitted my entire home with different types of SONOS equipment. I made my own 5:1 system in my great room. It’s fantastic! I love that I can adjust the different parts of the system separately or all together. I added two play1’s on my patio with an outdoor tv. The sound is great and I couldn’t be more pleased with my system, worth every penny! My next purchase will be two Play5’s for the game room. It’s high quality equipment with awesome sound, I’m very satisfied.

title: From the Best to the Worst
text: Newest update is VERY bad!  Changing from room to room is VERY poor!   When a different room is selected, the app does not respond, i.e. the room does not change to the desired room.  What you have to do to effect a room change is group the desired room with the existing room, complete it, and then go back into the grouped rooms and click off the no longer desired room, leaving the targeted room by itself.  I’ve contacted Sonos directly by phone to no avail.  They just don’t understand the issue.  From a great app to one of the worst with the recent updates!

title: Good not great
text: I recently moved into a new house.  Decided to NOT wire up my old system that ran great. Took the SONOS Plunge. Great quality stuff!  Great sound!  Not cheap.  Nothing you really have converts over or blends with Sonos. Seems like lots of REGULAR hiccups. Internet issues / cutting in and out at times / not playing specific songs from your iTunes library or only playin 60 seconds of a song then skipping to the next song. Very frustrating.  Their customer service team is very nice. Usually a 30 min wait by phone.  But at this point it’s been a love hate relationship with me and my full system. Sound Bar, 2 Sonos 1’s and a $700 subwoofer.  Sometimes it the greatest invention ever... other times can be frustrating.  I hope they can fix the issues I am having.

title: New Update not intuitive
text:
While the new update has solved some of the connectivity issues of its predecessor; however, I agree with other reviewers that the new format is unintelligible and frustrating. 

Switching between rooms less simple. The previous version made better use of vertical and horizontal menu bars to separate functions. Now, all functions are found along the bottom horizontal bar and there seems to be more screens to jump through to reach certain functions. 

Maybe the current configuration is actually better and I just need to get used to it. I'd be interested to hear from new users who have never experienced the previous versions.

title: Sonos improvements
text: I have had this system with five zones for a little over a year. The dramatic improvements they’ve made in their operability and ease of use is phenomenal. I am a music aficionado and used to have Bulky receivers wires and amplifiers that when used in any type of higher volume you could cook an egg on Due to the heat emissions all of that is gone and now I control everything from my iPhone. Last but not least I want great sound quality and Sonos deliver hands down every bit Of sound quality if not better than I had before. Awesome products!!

title: Not as good as it was
text: When I bought all my gear about 7 years ago it seemed like Sonos just worked. In recent years, I get advertisements. Pop-ups when trying to open the app telling me about some new thing. When I just want to play music I go to connect to a Play5 and it needs updated. There really needs to be a mode where it freezes everything in time and you can use it from there in like a non connected device. It’s like the Xbox vs old Nitendo. Remember the 8 bit Nintendo? You wanted to play a game. You put in the game and played.  Not with the Xbox, you want to play a game for 10 mins and it takes 20 to update it. Unnecessary.

title: Changes limit performance
text:
I’ve been using sonos for over 5 years in 3 different homes. I was an avid supporter, and even bought shares when they went public. This shows how much I’ve enjoyed their products and services in the past. That’s changing now. 

Sonos’ lack of ability to support legacy devices is a concern both economically and enviornmentally. That’s well reported on the internet. Who wants to invest in expensive speakers that become obsolete in a few years with no major performance upgrades” 

The other big problem I have with Sonos is that they no longer allow you to play specific media from the controlling device. One of the great pleasures I enjoyed was having friends play music from THEIR phones when they visited. It is also a real pain to have to stream content when you are in a remote area with limited access. 

Still good products and an ok experience other than the points mentioned above. BTW I sold my shares- can buy them back header  if the company gets its act together. 

E.P.

title: Problems Problems Problems
text:
Sonos worked for years with my older Play 5’s and several iPods and iPhones. Then the dreaded track skipping and loss of connections started. By uninstalling Sonos software then powering down/restarting the device and reinstalling Sonos I could usually get thing running again. Rebooting my router was sometimes a help. 

About a year ago went through several submissions with Sonos tech support. They helped once by pointing out that the router and Sonos must be on different channels. Several times the tech support tried to tell me there were issues with AC power lines in the walls near the speakers. And other electronic devices nearby - none were close. And remember things worked fine for years. And work fine after software updates. 

Biggest help was when Sonos releases updated software. Can usually tell an update is coming when problems start again and are not fixable.  

Last two tech support requests and build diagnostics were simply ignored. 

Great and enjoyable system when it works. Lousy when it does not.

title: Confused/Confusing
text:
Why fix what wasn't broke?  This new version is terrible. Lost its intuitive sense. I've tried to get used to the new layout, new browse, search and 'My Sonos' interfaces. Still trying to feel at home. Please revert to the older layout. This is slow, unresponsive, confusing, and not in line with the experience we enjoyed before this latest update. Terrible

Current version is even better. Great interface updates and easy access to the multiple streaming services. Stil....Simple, intuitive, a case study in excellent development. Thank you, Sonos!

title: Speakers are good... App is terrible.
text:
This app is incredibly glitchy and unstable. It will just randomly not find my music, skip songs in a playlist and stop playback on a podcast (both when the podcast is downloaded to the phone or just streaming from stitcher)… but wait, there’s more!
It also randomly loses/unpairs speakers when they haven’t been unplugged/moved, often has trouble connecting to my music/etc... services, lags on playback, and the new feature of playback directly from the phone via Airplay is nowhere to be found. When you pay this amount of many for speakers that must be controlled by an app, the app better be solid. This one isn’t.

*********9/1/18*********
Update! The website the developer suggests for hints on how to get around their sub-par app design is “disabled for the time being.”

Here’s a recommendation, guys:
Don’t make me work to figure out how to make your app function the way it should… Make a better app.

title: GREAT sound, terrible user interface.
text:
I have a Play 5 in the living room, and a Play 3 I carry back and forth between the office and wood shop.  The sound is GREAT.  

The user interface sacrifices “easy to use” for clean.  Too many clicks in too many different locations and styles.  Search on the top on one page, and at the bottom on another.  Vertical buttons to choose stations, but horizontal tabs to switch between composer, song, album etc. for search.  Ellipses (...) to expand one level of search, right arrow to expand the next, down arrow to play all in one place, or to play one in another.  It’s almost as if they were shooting for confusing.  The design is bad enough I use the speakers less than I would otherwise.

title: Barely Connects Anymore - Updates Made Unusable
text:
Bought about a grand worth of Sonos speakers (including the sub) for our house and it worked amazingly with songs on my iPhone for the first several months. Many unnecessary, bloated updates later and this proprietary system most of the time does not even see our network; when it does, speakers and rooms are missing or grouped incorrectly.

Sound quality is awesome, but it works so sporadically anymore that we barely use it. Definitely not a router issue. The only real changes were the “updates” to make Sonos so Web 2.0 “dude”-like which in actuality just made it less stable and introduced services I have no use for and in a format that is nigh impossible to troubleshoot.

Thank you Sonos for taking my money and leaving me with some sleek black paperweights!

title: Great system, new app is horrible.
text: No need to go into the greatness of the Sonos system. Everything has already been said. But I would like to add my voice to the chorus of users who hate the ridiculous new app interface. Non-intuitive and confusing, the app has made me reach for my Sonos less, because it’s always an exercise in frustration. Please, do better, put it back to a simpler UI like you had before, and then stop mucking around with it. NOBODY wants to learn a completely new app if they are used to an interface that is an integral part of their lives. Get a clue.

title: I love my Sonos!
text: I love my Sonos system! I love being able to listen to music throughout my home via WiFi & able to control it with my phone, also my son’s Sonos system while I babysit at their home! 👍👍👍 different stations for different listening areas! 👍👍👍 if my mood changes, it’s easy to change the music 🎶 w/o even getting up & hunting for the Just right Music! Can even go to bed w/sleep timer set & no worries of music playing all night! So you can see we ❤️ our Sonos system & its. I’ve add on gift ideas for the family too. We’ve built ours over several Christmases!

title: Worst app update EVER
text: Why ruin something that’s perfect? Sonos, you screwed this up. Please bring back the previous version of your app. This one stinks. It’s not easy to use. A once intuitive, simple UI is now some jacked confusing app that discourages use of the app which is equally important to the quality of the speakers. I hope you listen to your consumers and make the necessary changes sooner than later. I’m serval thousands of dollars deep in sonos product but won’t hesitate for a second to find my new sonos if you don’t listen to your consumers and get back to simplicity in your app.

title: Simply the Best!
text:
If you are considering a speaker system for your home, you have found it! Look no further. It is simply the best. Yes, it is more expensive than other systems, but you get what you pay for. Easy to set up, easy to enjoy. Makes for a great surround system for watching movies, or for simply listening to
music. I can’t say enough great things about it. Just buy it, but think of it as an investment. You will get so much enjoyment from it. You won’t be disappointed. (Sounds like a Marketing message from Sonos, I know. But it’s not. I’m just a satisfied customer 😊).

title: Betrayed loyal Sonos fans
text:
I’m not one to leave reviews but something had to be said with this new app and the direction Sonos is taking. I got into the “Sonos ecosystem” a few years ago and LOVED it. Sound is great and was easy to use. I have 2 beams, 3 Sonos Ones, 1 Playbar, 1 Sub and the new Move. So I am very familiar with their offerings and have been happy until today. 

I was going to upgrade my Playbar to the ARC but not anymore. Sonos decided to make all my current Sonos obsolete and came out with this new app. No longer supporting these “old” devices in unacceptable when you pay a premium for Sonos. The new app icon looks depressing (grey and small font), the wording under the app is too long and is crammed together. All they needed to do is name it Sonos S1 and keep the app icon black and bold. 

As far as future updates.... I understand technology becomes obsolete but saying anything after May 2020 is obsolete is a JOKE!!!! Heck at least Apple iPhones receive updates on 5 year old devices. 

Sonos will lose ALOT of loyal customers if they don’t undo these wrongdoings. 

Sonos if you are reading this... PLEASE LISTEN TO YOUR CUSTOMERS or you too will fall.

title: I’ve fallen out of love with Sonos
text:
With this update Nov. 2019, Sonos requires my phone location data to setup a speaker. Since I refuse to do that, I can’t setup my speakers anymore. I talked to customer service and they confirm it’s the only way. Also, it’s not as easy to use anymore. Speakers get lost and you have to reconnect them. And now this. What once was a magical experience is now not even usable. I have 2 Play speakers that won’t connect anymore without my phone’s location data. 

Previous review: Love it!
It connects to all my music services. I can control it from all my devices. Easy to setup. Great way to listen to music at home. We have the little play speaker and it fills our living room. They are always adding and improving integrations with music services.

title: Terrible system
text: Have had the system for years and I barley use it anymore because it is nonstop troubles. We have 5 speakers positioned throughout the house. At least 50% of the time the system doesn’t recognize one or more of the speakers. The speakers that it chooses not to recognize switches so it isn’t a bad speaker. I can almost never get all 5 to work at one time. They no longer allow you to wirelessly play music off your own phone which is ridiculous. You can try to go line in but that means your phone has to be stationary by a speaker and then again we found that it won’t broadcast to all speakers. The system generally seems to work with steaming services with the issue of speakers still not being able to be found.

title: Remarkable sound
text: First and foremost, the sound quality is superb. I purchased four Sonos 5 speakers for downstairs rooms & the sound transition from one room to the next is seamless. It was also a snap to install. But for me, the biggest takeaway is that I can take these with in the event that I ever move. I have had state of the art speakers systems before, which became fixtures that remained fire the next homeowner. I now own something that is more versatile, is equal to better regarding sound & they can be taken to a future residence if u ever move again. Great purchase and very fair price for the quality.

title: Works, but UI is a battle.
text: The UI is problematic.  Have been using for a couple of years and it has slowly evolved to something less intuitive than it used to be.  Something as simple as switching between TV and a speaker grouping is not obvious at all (where it once was).  This shows up in situations where I want to play a playlist (day, holiday music) while having the sound off on a football game.   Switching to the TV is can be done by changing volume with the TV remote.  Switching back to the playlist in resuming is...not obvious in the least.  If I do figure it out I generally have to restart the shuffles playlist.  Anyway, it works but frustration marrs the experience.

title: Crashes on return to app
text:
Sonos is a great system for playback. The app could use more work though. 

The current update (9.2) crashes when to switch apps and return. It can take 15 seconds to finally die so you can launch it again. I’ve taken to force quitting to restart it faster.

Another annoyance I face is the tedious 5-10 second modal dialog delay to tell me the number of tracks added to the queue. I like to queue up an artist’s albums from my library. A different, non-modal method could be equally effective and reduce the time required to set up a new queue.

title: Dated, Buggy
text:
I run the Sonos controller between mobile and desktop on two networks. While the mobile app is by far the better of the two apps they do not play well together. 

Primary problem: constantly getting the error message on desktop saying “your Apple Music account named X needs to be reauthorized.” I’ve complied multiple times (which can only be done on mobile) to no avail. I can play for a short time before getting the error again. Playing via mobile almost always works but I am unable to play on desktop, though I can skip songs, pause, etc, just not search or select new music. 

Annoyance: design and UX is inconsistent between apps.

title: Mixed - old interface great. New interface stinks. I mean stinks awful. Fire the developer
text:
I’ve had the sonos system throughout our home for 2 years. I love the sound quality.  
I loved the old interface in the iPhone and iPad which was very easy to use and made so much sense. Even my 70 year old parents were wowed how easy to use. I used to recommend sonos all the time. 5 stars for old system. 

I just downloaded the new interface. The NEW interface is AWFUL compared to the old. More steps to do the same thing. Less intuitive. Can’t jump between rooms as easily. Many times it won’t add or drop a room until the second or third try now.  Can’t find favorites as easily.  They must be banking on people interacting w Alexis Voice interface. Two thumbs down and rework it. 1 star for this. I would literally fire the team that developed this. I would not recommend to anyone until fixed. This is how a company loses market share quickly. 

Please offer old UI. I would back track to it if I could.  I would add to the 6 sonos speakers I own.

title: 2 months in & Version 8 is horrible. UI is NOT intuitive.
text:
I miss the simplicity and ease of version 7. Give me back the easy to use and understand App you used to have. 

I don’t listen to music like I once did with older App versions. I got excited by music with versions 5, 6 and 7.  Now I loathe using the “new, improved” App. So many more steps in the new version to do just the same things I did intuitively on previous versions. 

Sonos, you make Great hardware, and I’ve bought in big time, but I refuse to buy more hardware when your App is so difficult to use. It’s time to correct it. 

Don’t stop listening to your customers. Please fix the App and its difficult to use layout. It actually hurts my head to do something simple like to try and play music in two rooms using the current version of the App now. I get frustrated by the horizontal and vertical movements. I’m constantly looking for what is playing in what room and how to change sources. 
 
I’ve tried it out for two months now and it just is not a good user experience. I have family members that will not use Sonos anymore. It’s been a difficult and sad last few months. 

I miss the old version

title: My huge investment is obsolete
text: I spent thousands of dollars to jump on the Sonos bandwagon with a house full of Play5s, Play 3s and the surround set up with a Playbar and sub. Great system which I have enjoyed.  I actually spent another load of cash to equip my office with Sonos because I was so happy with it. Today I’m enraged.  I got an email that my investment is no longer going to be supported and offered a lame discount to upgrade or I can watch my system lose functionality and become useless. Very frustrating and feels like the same game every company plays of constantly designing obsolescence. Thought Sonos was different, but rather than expand their market they choose to screw their existing customers to extort more revenue.  Think twice before you buy from this company.

title: Some Quirks but Good
text:
Let's start by saying my Sonos Play 5 speaker produces excellent sounds including rich bass.  Truly a quality speaker!  It connects well to internet radio stations, Pandora, Apple Music, ect...
Where Sonos fails (or Apple) is playing personal MP3's using Apples Airplay wireless protocol.  
In this situation the sound quality significantly reduces, is not rich, low volume regardless of cranking the speaker.  It also skips songs and acts all kinds of wonky using Airplay. 
This is a big bummer if you own MP3's and want to play them back without using a paid service to host them for wifi playback. 
If this gets resolved this will be an amazing setup.  It's still pretty good, but you have to make compromises.

title: App upgrade is a step backwards
text:
I’m not anti-development at all, in fact my IT Support company been supporting Sonos systems since the first beta units, and I know you need to “break a few eggs to make an omelet”.  

As Sono’s ecosystem continues to expand, what you need is a UI that simplifies the admittedly complex task of joining multiple sources to multiple groupings of multiple outputs. 

I’m sure that’s what you were shooting for here, but from a raw user perspective, this app is not intuitive and offers little to no improvement over its predecessor - which sadly in the modern mobile universe equals a step backwards.

title: Used to work great
text: The speakers are great but the app and getting the music to the speakers is broken. My iPhone used to play all my music perfectly but now after some recent updates all my songs skip half way through playing. I’ve called customer service and have been told there is basically no fix right now other than to just wait and hope they figure it out. I believe it has something to do with the apps compatibility with iPhones. Whatever it is, they need to fix it because it seems to be a common problem from what I can find online. I would definitely not recommend Sonos until they can figure these issues out. I feel like a have been cheated out of some very expensive speakers that won’t even allow me to play my own music on them.

title: Yet another app-update-made-it-worse story
text: I just don’t get why companies update apps to make them worse.  Love My Sonos speakers, wouldn’t want to do without them.  But the app no longer lets me control volume or playback when my iPhone is in lock screen, which makes it a real clumsy hassle to just turn music down or skip a song.  First world problems, I know, but why remove that feature?  My wife and kids already complain that they have to use phones to adjust volume on the TV (we have the soundbar and subwoofer), and this update just made that more of an issue.  Can’t get my TV remote to work consistently with the soundbar, so that’s not a good option either.  Please rollback the latest update, it was better before!
