title: Great speakers, horrible app
text:
Sonos speakers sound great, except when the app disconnects and turns off the speakers randomly. This happens for our speakers when playing music, audiobooks, and podcasts, as often as every 5 minutes sometimes. This of course makes listening on Sonos very difficult, as the app is also a bit slow and clunky. (I wouldn’t have too big of an issue with the slowness of the app, except that I have to restart it repeatedly)
On a side note, Sonos also needs to incorporate podcasts better. Podcasts subscribed to cannot be streamed, but must be downloaded. In addition, it is very difficult to navigate through the podcast precisely with just a slider and no rewind/fast-forward buttons like the native iOS app.

title: Only a Mensa member can play a song with v8.2.1
text:
First, the speakers are awesome.  Best I’ve ever owned and I have 6 of them around the house and wouldn’t trade them for anything out there comparable.

The app leaves a lot to be desired though and it seems like each upgrade is more confusing.  The latest upgrade is not user friendly.  It takes me a legit 30 seconds to figure out how to play a song almost every single time.  Luckily there is now Alexa integration and she’s smart enough to figure out how to do it.  Also, I used to never have lag time with any speakers and now it feels like I regularly have issues with doing something in the app and it taking 5-10secs to execute on a speaker.

title: It’s great......when it works
text: This system is great when it’s all working but that’s only about 60% of the time. Just about the time I get everything back up and running, here comes a mandatory update and poof, half the system disappears and I spend the next month troubleshooting trying to get the forgotten speakers paired back up. This has been the cycle for the past year. When I first got all of them there were rarely updates and this was never an issue. I can’t say I’d recommend it with the cost being high along with frustration.

title: App updates force new set-ups
text: Like most apps, this one updates frequently. The problem is these updates often will leave you without functionality until you spend have your day on the internet trying to figure out how to reset back to factory settings, googling online chat room support, reconnecting the system to your WI-FI network and more. Sometimes the app updates seamlessly, sometimes I can get my music back up in just 20 minutes and sometimes it can take several hours or even days.  In either case, you’ll be on your own.  Aside from the updates and the associated loss of one’s music until you can reestablish, Sonos is a great system.

title: July 2020 update lost wifi-enabled coms
text:
(This is comment specific to Sonos S1 and older hardware.)
Using the hardware Sonos OS version 11.2, the iOS devices currently cannot connect with hardware over wifi-enabled. Once I hardwire plug the Sonos hardware using an ethernet cable, the system works perfectly fine again. I am currently trying to troubleshoot the wifi disconnect. Did the Sonos team accidentally disable wifi-enabled connectivity?

For all those folks out there slamming Sonos currently for loss of use, please try hardwire connecting your primary Sonos component to ethernet connection. Update your reviews if this setup change or troubleshooting corrects your Sonos problems.

title: Bluetooth...but expensive and worse!
text:
After using Sonos products for a few years now, there never ceases to be problems and issues. One would think, given the hefty price tag in comparison to regular Bluetooth products, that this service would work! But unfortunately, it stinks. 

The interface is confusing and uncooperative, which makes you repeat the same steps over and over again to merely change the song. Songs often pause, stop, or skip without fail despite having a very strong internet connection. 

The best thing Sonos has going for it is their marketing team. Clever to mix technology already readily available, rename it, and jack up the price for dumb rich people to waste their money on. Bravo.

title: Continuous AirPlay Issues
text:
How difficult is it to have your product just work as advertised? My Sonos Move CONSTANTLY just stops working when using AirPlay, requiring the unit to be hard rebooted for it to work again, just for it to happen again a little later. It’s not just my phone as it happens with other devices on other wireless networks as well. This does not happen when casting to other AirPlau devices. This is completely unacceptable considering how expensive the device is. It’s super embarrassing when it fails moments after someone comments about how they couldn’t justify spending that much on a speaker and that it better be amazing. 

You guys need better QA before releasing products and updates. This is 101 stuff!

title: Security Issues
text: This app is weird. I’m not logged into it at all and I was able to add  my Apple account to the app. Now that I’m am trying to remove it I can’t. B/C I need a password to get into the users account. I shouldn’t be able to add my music to the account w/o verifying the account to begin with. The only thing I had to do was verify my Apple password and it gave the user access without logging in. Now my Apple Music is stuck on the users account and they refuse to remove it. How is it that I was able to add it easily but now I can’t remove me music. That’s a security issue for me, because Apple Music has nothing to do with Sonos. If I can’t fix with rep I will be contacting Apple and reporting this app

title: What Happened in the Last Update to Ruin Sonos?
text:
I want to first say we absolutely love our Sonos system. We often recommend it to others as the only true, seamless audio & app experiences out there. It just WORKS - until it doesn’t, evidently.

This last update has been a NIGHTMARE. Speakers frequently drop off the “Everywhere” network. You wait five or ten minutes and they may “re-appear,” they may not, requiring hard physical reboots (not easy when the speakers are sitting on shelving near the ceiling). The volume control on the speakers is spotty - again, sometimes it works, and sometimes it has no effect.

When something works perfectly for a long time, you come to expect perfection. So, Sonos, PLEASE: get the app back into perfect shape. Until then, you’re hitting a very sour note in this household.

title: Sonos changed my life
text:
The play 5 speakers are powerful and natural sounding gems. The room tuning step dials them into your space and really makes them sing!
The seamless phone interface makes it super easy to access and play all your virtual music and the mini plug in allows me to play my records on the turntable and still get that crystal clear and powerful sound from the speakers. 
Thank you Sonos for keeping music at the forefront of my life experience with killer sound and the ability to access any of my tunes across all platforms instantly. 
Love you so hard!
Jon Theodore

title: Recent update killed Apple compatibility
text: I used to love using Sonos to control music streaming throughout my house. It was so easy to reach down and change the volume on my iPhone without even needing to remove it from my pocket. I also loved controlling Sonos from my Apple Watch - it was so convenient and pretty cool too! Since the recent update, I can’t do either of those things. Sonos went from seamlessly connected to my Apple devices to practically no compatibility overnight. I called and registered my complaint, but if things don’t get fixed I will definitely be replacing my Sonos system with something more compatible with my Apple devices. Come on, Sonos, don’t “update” your system with new software that takes a giant step backward.

title: Upgraded App is less intuitive than previous version with no real value-add
text:
This recently updated version of the Sonos Controller App, in which the entire App and the way in which users navigate through rooms and sources, is less intuitive than the previous version, harder to navigate, offers a more challenging user experience and is overall less user-friendly than before. 

Sonos, please go back and look at the steps it takes to group in additional players, browse sources and search content from streaming sources. Ease of navigation has taken a hit with this new version.

title: Update?
text:
I’ve tried updating my controller twice—each time it bumps me back to the App Store, itself, not allowing for any updates. This happened with another update several months ago. SONOS said the problem was on Apple’s end. 

SONOS and Apple- would you please get on the same page about how/when you release your updated versions???

Update 2: still not working. SONOS: how about actually making your updates work? 8 speakers, sub, amp, etc etc. Good at marketing but not good at updating and keeping it smooth. Please go back to basics! #makesonosgreatagain

title: Unbelievable ordeal when changing network
text:
Satisfied with sound, yadda yadda yadda. 

But there are no words to describe how unbelievably maddening the experience is of moving to a new place, or changing a WiFi network, which is what I have done three times over the past years. With different Sonos speakers, in different continents. The help and guidance on the website and within the app is useless. The speaker cannot be found on the new network. It’s been gone now, for 4 months. Occasionally when I feel optimistic, I try again, hoping just like the last time this happened, it will magically appear again and work perfectly, as it has done in the past.
If you have a move or network change coming up, don’t buy.

title: Theme lately
text:
Looking through the latest review there seems to be a theme. See if you’ve heard this one before. 

I’ve had SONOS speakers for 10 plus years. Added on new ones as I had the opportunity. I’ve sworn by them and promoted them. But now, they have alienated their customer(s) by doing an update that killed the “bridge” shut my system down and it doesn’t find my WiFi.  So, no internet, no music.  Keep in mind the fix is to unplug my router and reset it. That doesn’t work.  Other option seems to be convenient. Switch out my bridge for a new one called boost?  So killed my bridge to sell me a new one?  Sounds like a legal issue. 

Sonos, you’ve lost your way and the genius behind the latest updates should be fired.  Contact me if you care.

title: Poor connection
text: I really really love the sound quality of my speaker (I have the play 3 but have had other Sonos speakers in the past). Lately I have been having really awful connection issues, whether my speaker is at my house or another house. I can’t seem to connect my app to the speaker (it says it’s a WiFi issue), and have downloaded the app on another phone & have tried using a different WiFi at different homes and am still having the same issue. I would love for this issue to be fixed - I feel like I shouldn’t have to call customer service to get my app to work.

title: 20 Second snippets
text:
I’m disappointed to write this but the reviews are true. I purchased my Sonos December 28, set it up on the 30th and installed the app. That’s when I saw all the reviews stating the song does not play to the end, but at some point skips to the next song. 
My fist use of the sonos app was fine, but this morning (12/31) my songs would move on before ending. After watching I noticed it happens when the app is no longer showing on my phone but in “rest” mode. When I let it slip into rest mode it will play the first 10-20 seconds of a song and then move to the next. 
Regardless of how good these speakers may sound, this is unacceptably poor performance. I am returning my speaker today. Too bad because these have always been reviewed as top internet connected speakers...

title: Enjoying my Sonos app
text: Really like the app so far especially since they added audible back as a service. It makes it easier to listen to books I don’t have to use both apps and airplay. I can simply pause, skip ahead or play directly from my remote app. I think it sounds better too playing through Sonos instead of air playing. Because the way our system is setup I would normally have to have the tv on when airplay which prefer not to and now I don’t have to, yay!! I am happy it’s easier to group rooms now I know this was part of previous update but I had yet to rate until now.

title: Great hardware
text: Please for the love of all that exists go back to the simple controls prior to the new UI. I think the way rooms worked previously was much more intuitive and easy to actually accomplish what is needed with many rooms. It's just messy. I hope this newest version fixes it by making things more available in the playing screen. But whatever you changed with the relationship of rooms and song selection (while I don't know exactly what it was anymore) I know it's frustrating and difficult. And I'm a pretty tech savvy person.

title: Bring back the old UI!!!
text: Love the Sonos product, HATE the latest upgrade.  I really don’t like how they separated favorites, with a carousel for playlists & separate list for stations. I enjoyed having my favorite playlist & stations all in the same scrollable list, it was quick and easy. I don’t care that some of my favorites are stations & others are playlist, I want all favorites together. I feel like there is 1 more tap to manage rooms now, I could be wrong but it feels like it’s 1 step further than it used to be when in playlist mode, however the rooms tab redesign at the bottom is nice. In short make favorites the way it was previously and I think it'll be ok.

title: Amazing system
text:
Sonos is the system I put in my new bay home and it is amazing.  I have always had class a circuitry hi fi systems over the years from turntables, cassettes, eight tracks and cds. I never could have imagined I could play any song in the universe in any room of the house and actually have a different song playing in every room of the house and control it from my cell phone.   This system is by far the best I have had and so easy to use and I run it thru some ceiling speakers with sub woofers throughout the house. I highly recommend Sonos to everyone. 
Dr Michael Lange

title: Annoying disconnects/security "features"/privacy debacle
text: Periodically disconnects ever since I setup a "Sonos account" and won't easily reconnect, won't reconnect without a password. Often reconnects only to immediately disconnect as soon as I attempt to play a song. (I guess keeping my music collection safe from prying eyes or pranksters who might try to park in front of my house and connect to it is more important than actually playing the music collection). Sonos used to be the simple solution to whole house music. I'm now looking for the new simple solution, will never buy another $400+ Sonos product unless two things happen: 1) fix the new privacy policy, (every Sonos buyer should google "sonos privacy") and 2) fix the software so that it works (since it used to work, I know it can be done).

title: I used to love it
text:
I’m about to wash dishes, and yet again my Kitchen speaker has decided to disappear.  I know it’s not my network connectivity because every other device in the house works flawlessly.  

The speakers are all great, but my most expensive devices (a connect:amp, play 5, a connect for my 15 year old home stereo receiver, and a play 3) are all not compatible with the newer software.   Fine, I can live with that, but the old software has become less reliable and is making what was once a great user experience into an a frustrating one.

I appreciate that Sonos has extended discounts to replace the old equipment, but I’m just not sure if I want to reinvest in what might be a never ending tech refresh cycle.  Was there nothing that could have been done to keep the old and new equipment on the same app?  

I hate to be so critical, because I think Sonos genuinely tries to be loyal to its customers and has supported all of the equipment in the lineup for a long time.  When I invested in my setup there was nothing close to what Sonos offered.

title: So nice.....
text: Over the past two weeks we have been enjoying our new Sonos system. Two play 5’s, a Play 1, and a sub have combined to produce a quality sound custom tuned to our living room. Coupled with a few streaming players and we have a pretty elaborate music library to enjoy as well. The set up was very straight forward and went along as described in the many forums I visited prior to purchase. I hope that we have continued performance with this system as music is important to us and this networked system has provided a killer outlet! Nice work Sonos.

title: Wide variety of music available, really good quality, can be confusing at the beginning
text:
This is a very good application. That’s all there really is to it. It allows me to play music from Apple Music or via my music library, and it works pretty well. My only real complaint is that for someone who just got the app, it could be difficult to remember the various little buttons, but that’s not an issue for me. The speakers that we got accompanying this app are pretty great, as well.
Highly recommended for those who like playing music around the house.

title: Great sound - glitchy app
text: I love my Sonos for streaming music, but I often use it for streaming podcasts from my phone, for which this app is incredibly glitchy. For the last several updates, it has been having issues after the episode is either paused or fastforwarded - after resuming, it plays for 2 or 3 minutes, then stops the episode and has no record of where it was previously. The app works fine if the episode is played through, but there’s really no way to pause it and then resume listening.

title: App has a lot of playback issues
text:
1) Songs downloaded on device skips when device goes to sleep mode. 2) Individual song  volume adjustment from iTunes does not carry over when using the Sonos app. 3) Volume levels are very low in general and increase/decrease is not gradual and somewhat loud sound doesn’t kick in until level is over 3/4...even when “Loudness” feature is enabled. 4) Not all of your unprotected, downloaded music appears in the app. 5) Lip sync feature is useless...it only adjust one way and I can’t tell if it delays or speeds up. 

I’ve had my speakers for over 4 years. If we have to use the app, allow it play ALL of our music without any issues. If my music can play without issues on a pair of $10 headphones, then it should be the same on +$300 speakers.

title: Issues playing music from IPhone
text: I’ve had Sonos since the beginning of 2018 and there is a problem with the app and playing music from the music library on the IPhone. I’ve updated the app every time I’m able and I’ve also used IPhone 6s and IPhone X. When I attempt to shuffle music from my library on my phone, a song will play for about 30 seconds and then it will stop and skip to the next song and begin playing the next song about 10 seconds into it. This is a small problem but it drives me nuts because this is mainly how I listen to my music. This issue is with the app only. I love the speakers, I have the 1, the play1 and the soundbar.

title: Top Shelf App
text:
One of the best in the Apple Store.  Works as advertised.  Simple and intuitive interface.  Tuning the full 5.1 theater system to fit the room using the iPad is ingenious.  SONOS is real sound.  One of the best investments I've ever made.

But their recent update has been problematic.  Though they've corrected the problems with TV sound cutting in and out (tech support was very responsive)...using a mobile device (iPad) as a playlist source is suddenly an issue.  Hard to connect sometimes, changes songs in the middle, or just quits.  It's NOT my home network.

title: Rooms out
text: I would love to say this is great.  It has been up until the last week, early January 2020.  Rooms randomly disappear from my app on phone, or hubby’s phone, or my iPad or hubby’s iPad.  Everything is update.  Everything was reset.  It’s a head scratcher.  I hope the Sonos “people “ listen to me any others out there in this same wonky bit.  If they do, and an update comes around soon, with these things fixed, I’d happily go back to five stars.  In the meantime, I’ll be listening to half of my six Sonos speakers.

title: Don’t waste your money!
text: I rate this a ZERO star!!!  We have 15 Sonos speakers and components and have spent at least $8,000. We initially loved Sonos!  Told all of our friends and family to buy Sonos.  Within this past year there was a new Sonos app.  We were told we can use our Sonos S1 app and have spent hours upon hours resetting our speakers and on tech support and NOTHING works!!!!  Not a single speaker!!!!  We have the amps we have the speakers we have the Move speakers....Don’t waste your money!!!!  We were told the technology has advanced and that’s why the system no longer supports these speakers.  So if you don’t mind spending thousands of dollars and then not being able to use any of your speakers in a couple of years then you should go for it.

title: Do not buy Sonos
text: I have purchased over $5,000 in Sonos products over the past five years. Woke up this morning to find that almost all of them no longer work properly because Sonos stopped providing updates to “legacy” products. Now I have two different apps controlling different devices throughout the house. Completely defeats the purpose of the system. Sonos says I can “fix” the “problem” they created by purchasing several thousand dollars of upgrades to my old speakers. Wow. I used to love this company, believed in them, but they just destroyed all the brand loyalty I had. And I’m wondering, how long before the newer products are artificially pushed out of use by Sonos, just so they can try to sell me new speakers? DO NOT BUY!!

title: Great speakers, terrible app
text: I love my speakers and have them in every room of the house. The app is absolutely not up to the standards of quality. Using it to try to group rooms, play or pause music, or really any basic function is a crapshoot, things rarely work the way you want on the first try and some you’ll just get frustrated enough to stop trying. On top of this, there’s an insane battery drain that developers have acknowledged on their support site as “normal,” expect to have 40+% of your phones battery life eaten by Sonos running in the background, even while you’re not listening to anything. Really disappointing software for impressive hardware, can’t believe they seemingly don’t value this aspect of their product at all.

title: Great product.. terrible access to customer service
text: Been a long time Sonos customer. Product works great....app works great.  However over the last several years they are inaccessible. Hold times can be hour or longer, no service on weekends when needed the most, etc. When ( if) you can ever reach customer service they will resolve the issue. I think co got too big too fast and should correct this problem but it’s been a while and still this problem with customer service. CEO needs to do his job and resolve this!!

title: Great until recent update
text:
Another update, another fail. I can no longer stream music from my device to my entire Sonos collection. Just one newer speaker. What a waste. Do yourself a favor and go with a different product all together. This is too expensive to not work the way it was intended to per the sales pitch. Hard pass!

A couple of months ago Sonos updated the control app. I’ve spent this time using it and trying to determine if it’s just me, or if the app really is as awful as I thought in the beginning. The GUI is terrible, it is difficult to change rooms and get back to choosing a source. The old app was so much easier to use. I am hopeful Sonos will go back to the previous version, or at least pull the best features from the previous version.

title: Great until they tried to integrate airplay
text: The Sonos app has been a great controller for my music from multiple sources, including iTunes. However, when they decided to try integrating airplay, presumably to make it easier, they missed the mark. When I try to control my speakers through AirPlay it rarely connects properly and when it does it’s linked to the service through my iPhone rather than directly through my WiFi network. Worst of all I lost the ability to control the system from my phone’s lock screen

title: SONOS
text: By far the best of the best. I’ve been listening to music since I could hear, and Sonos is all that you expect from sound equipment only better. Every room and every location on my premise that I can feed with WiFi has some type of sonos sound system,I can go from each room or area and the music or whatever I’m listening to at the time goes with me not only that it’s there before I’m ever thinking about moving there,or I can have something different on all or part of the system just by using my phone or device LOVE LOVE LOVE my SONOS.

title: Wow. All of the sudden it’s terrible!!
text:
No more audio controls from lock screen! Sonos now constantly struggles to find my network when nothing has changed but the fact that I recently updated the app. It eventually figures it out, but tries to get me to troubleshoot my network first as if the problem is on my end, then without me doing anything it magically figures it out and starts working. App is more laggy now, too. Freezes up and takes a minute to figure out what it’s doing before it resumes function. 

I don’t know what you guys did, but you screwed stuff up. Undo whatever you did and make it work right again!!!! When I pay hundreds of dollars for a single speaker, I would like to be able to count on the software to be able to work flawlessly.

title: Latest Update is Terrible
text:
It's much harder to navigate and requires more steps to change music in different rooms.  
Although the syncing to music services is better, the app rehaul leaves much to be desired.  
For example: under Sonos favorites, why on earth would you have only a few icons showing and require me to select "show all". Yes. I want all my favorites the first time. 
Furthermore, it's confusing to have to select room group then go to a whole new page to select music.  It lost the sleek, elegant style one typically associates with the Sonos brand.

title: New Version 8.0:  Hardest to Navigate in Years
text: I’ve had Sonos with 8 zones in my home for 4 years.  Have always and still love it but the new OS has sadly taken a few steps backwards.  My whole family is really struggling with it’s UI, which is confusing and convoluted and much harder to navigate than ever before. It’s not intuitive on how to select songs, group zones, and just in general figure out where you are.  Sorry Sonos. Love you and you’ll do better next time but someone seriously dropped the ball on the consumer experience with this version.

title: Needs work
text: I don’t have many complaints as I really like the Sonos products. The one I wish it would do better is integrating with my other music apps, specifically Sirius XM. I use the Sirius player on my computer at work and it show a page with all my favorite stations and what song is currently playing on each station so I can choose what I want to hear. On the app I have play each station and see if they are playing a song I want to hear. Would be awesome if I could see what songs were playing on each station.

title: Annoying!
text: I have had enough.  I have had these speakers for 2 years, and lately I need to update the app like every week.  Now, one or more or my speakers just vanishes and no matter what I do I cannot get it back.  I try to connect a new product, but never finds it.  I try find a missing product, same result.  Then, after a few days, if the stars align, my speaker just shows up to work again?  But, it soon gets tired and takes another vacation.   Having simple Bluetooth speakers would work much better.  Or, maybe I will even go back to wires....I just want to turn on my music without a 15 minute ordeal ever 5th time.   I will not be buying anymore Sonos and will be hooking the ones I have up to Cat5 cables instead.

title: App downgrade!
text:
Was a huge fan of Sonos but after their most recent app update, I can’t relocate/edit track positions in my que/playlist. I’ve contacted customer support and according to them the app never had this functionality, so I guess I must’ve been high on dope for the past several years and it was just my mind playing tricks on me that I was able to use this function before.. 
Thanks for nothing Sonos customer support!

Update: ability to relocate tracks in queue is available (thank goodness). However, it’s almost impossible to see if using the dark light mode on iOS. Would be great if Sonos app could update to accommodate this dark mode feature on iOS.  Thank You!

title: This nightmare DO NOT BUY
text: After paying ridiculous amount money this terrible product doesn’t want connect to sonos app. I have sonos beam and sonos one. First time when i paired i didnt have any issue now i reseted both of the speakers to factory i had issue connecting sonos one but it worked took little longer. Now here comes beam when i try to connect im getting try again over and over. I reseted beam unplugged power and held the button in the back and plugged it back on held it until light stared blocking orange and let it go. I restarted router deleted sonos app re downloaded nothing seems to working. When it worked finally i didnt have option in the app to group speakers beam and sonos one so i rested again and dont want connect. RETURNING THIS CRAP AND STAYING WITH MY LG SYSTEM COST ME FRACTION AND NEVER HAD ANY ISSUE LIKE THIS TRASH.

title: Sonos brings feature equivalency.
text:
*updated 18/Aug/2018*
A month later, and I’m continuing to see general instability, particularly with the app, which has become almost unusable. It crashes and hangs constantly on both my iPad Air 2 and iPhone X, requiring the app to be killed and restarted. Disappointed that quality control and the “it just works” ethos is beginning to fall apart. 

*updated 20/July/2018*
With this latest update, I’m finding my Sonos system is unstable, with the app crashing / becoming unresponsive. Plus I’m finding music playback is glitching a lot, especially when playing back Tidal. It’s gone from being super reliable, it-always-just-works to glitchy and unstable. I’ve even hard wired as my as my Sonos devices as possible. 

*previous review below*
With the most recent update, Sonos has now introduced feature equivalency between their own handheld controller and the iPhone app. Most important addition is the control of Windows Media Player streaming music libraries - a feature that was sadly missing from the first version of the app - great to have it now added! Great job by Sonos - they continue to exceed my expectations!

title: UGH!
text:
So here’s where UI design trumps everything, and to an extremely negative degree. The first few days I found this update completely unintuitive, useless in fact.

I’m beginning to find my way around it, but just the fact that I’m now forced to see my entire library as HUGE thumbnails, as opposed to providing an option to view as a LIST, with ability to sort based on my preferences - really?

This is what happens when the UX team is allowed to run amok without putting it front of any real, existing users and getting genuine feedback.

title: The worst updates
text: The past two updates (forced) have made the app more difficult, annoying and if I didn’t had several speakers I would definitely delete this app. It is so frustrating that I’m forced to use this app. I can’t switch from one speaker to the other like I used to. I have to select both then select one, I have to click more options to get to my music. If I turn off one speaker the selected one. Then the other speakers also turn off without being selected.  Please change it back!

title: Great sound throughout the house!
text: We just got a home and put a play1 in the kitchen and bathroom and a play3 in the living room. It is so nice to be able to walk around the house and have great music playing in he main spaces and it doesn't have to be super loud to hear it!  We often turn on fun bath time music for the kids and just have it playing in the bathroom. I love that we can control the volume and music selection of the individual speakers. Can't wait to add some more as time passes to really fill in the space and other rooms.

title: Disappointed in new Sonos App
text:
Revised review down after Nov 14 update: While I am a longtime Sonos user and EVANGELIST, the new UI is bad. Grouping used to be easier, music selection used to be easier. I've had to explain it to other users when the older versions were intuitive. 

I would suggest another round of usability changes.

Plus, how much did Pandora pay you all to put ads after EVERY song? Are you getting a cut of the Pandora premium subscriptions?  I used to be able to listen to 15+ minutes of music between ads. And now it is a 20-30 second ad after EACH song. Unacceptable!

title: Expensive and worth it
text:
The speakers are pricey and they have to be plugged into the wall. 
Those are the only drawbacks. I’ve been an audiophile since the ‘70s and these are the best for vinyl. I have two gen 1. Play 5’s and four of the Play 3’s. Great indoors or out. The gen 1 Play 5’s have an 1/8 inch out for your record player and an option for compression to your taste. 

Can’t speak to the Play 1’s. I go for the power, and Sonos has plenty. I’ve never turned it up to full volume, and I’ve had big outdoor parties. Awesome!

title: The sounds, oh the sounds
text: I have 2 Sonos Play1’s (Gen 1) in stereo in my living room. They fill my entire 2 bedroom apartment will clear sounds. The bass, treble, and mids all seem pretty well balanced. As of now, I’m looking into getting the Sonos Sub to complete the act. The app is super easy to use, no tutorial needed. I like how to can add songs from different platforms to the queue. First song from Apple music, next from SoundCloud, back to Apple Music, then Tidal. Enjoying your entire library from different subscriptions in one app.

title: Sonos is not what it used to be
text: My trust in Sonos is gone. I purchased 5 speakers for my home with the intension of having a great sound system. Sonos is now restricting my access to owned music and it appears based on the email from their CEO that your long term plan is to force planned obsolescence with your equipment. I primarily purchased Sonos for your speakers. The company now seems to make their streaming service their focus and will use forced upgrades as a tool to require their customers to purchase their latest speakers. Shame on you Sonos. I was once a very loyal customer. You have shown your true agenda and I would never purchase or recommend your speakers or services again. Your excessive greed will be your companies downfall. You need new leadership.

title: Life changer !
text:
If you enjoy music as much as I do, I can say that my investment in Sonos speakers is one of my best. 
 I’ve lived with several other makes but none compared to the fidelity and rich sound and deep bass response in such small and unobtrusive units. 
 The controller app gives such convenient access to the music of the world both old and new in mere seconds. Awesome. 
 Being able to use the app to tune sound using the TRUEPLAY feature which reads my personal space for items which both absorb sound and reflect it is really unique, sound is tailored to my living space, and I can move or adjust it at my whim with the touch of a finger. 
 Giant speaker boxes that take up lots of space are technology dinosaurs. 
 Sonos is state of the art and sounds better !
 Being able to easily move my speakers anywhere in or around my home is unmatched versatility.

title: Quality speaker; app needs help
text: We had been looking forward to having a Sonos speaker in our home for quite some time. The speaker quality is great, but the app and streaming needs some fine tuning. After doing all adjustments from our home with our router, etc., the app will still skip through songs when streaming, but more especially when I’m just trying to play songs from my own playlist. This is super frustrating. This has us second guessing about the additional speaker purchases we wanted to make. Hoping this can be cleaned up. I have read several reviews online with a similar frustration.

title: Speakers great, not a fan of the Sonos app
text: The speakers are great, great sound.  But, the app is super glitchy.  Freezes or just turns off frequently.  I wish you could just connect your phone through Bluetooth and run music through these speakers without using the Sonos app!  If you run SiriusXM through it, especially listening to any on demand programs....forget it, can’t fast forward or rewind....so when the app shuts down on you in the middle of a show, which will happen, when you reboot everything you cannot go back to where you left off....you have to start the show from the beginning.  Once connect everything sounds great, I just wish the interface with certain subscriptions and app worked better as it’s the only way to use Sonos speakers.

title: You can do better than this
text:
My Iphone 6 plus failed on me after last software update, so I got a replacement from Verizon which comes with the previous ios but I need it to download my apps again. Sonos app was work good for me before, now I can not do nothing because the app want to be updated, what about we stupid customer want?, who will update after such a “great” reviews ? 
  It is sad that Sonos became like others and give us worst with any update. I do not know who check those updates before they are released but seams they not check it right and maybe like others they do a basic check on devices loaded just with their app which is a little different from real life. 
  You will see on Ebay my Sonos speaker
  Life for sure will exist without Sonos

title: Update issues-
text: Since latest update our Sonos for television has stopped working. Our home automation company told us they have another client with same issue and only way to resolve it is to add a sound bar. They reached out to Sonos and were told that was the only option. We have Lutron and Harmony system. Why should we be forced to purchase another piece of equipment for a system that worked just fine for 3 years and because of an update no longer works. Instead of using one remote or a single app we now have to use 2 devices or 2 apps to watch and hear our tv. Why would I stay with Sonos if every update will result in purchasing another piece of equipment? You can do better than this.

title: New App Stinks
text:
While the old UI definitely had a lot of room for improvement, the new UI is not working for me.  It’s constantly prompting me to update - though the updates tell me the system is already up to date.  Worse, simple tasks like grouping rooms don’t work properly anymore.  I’m not sure what has changed culturally at Sonos - but I’ve got 3 subs, 2 sound bars, and 3 play 5’s across 3 rooms and they used to be an awesome home feature - now due to recent changes in the app this is becoming a terrible and unreliable investment.

Update - finally seems to have updated my rooms correctly and I can get into the app and use it again.  I’ve bumped to 2 stars as it’s still not as reliable as it had been.

title: New Experience is worse for multi room
text: I’ve used Sonos for years and am a very happy customer. My family has 5 zones (3 singles, pair of 1’s, and an amp). When we received this UX update, my wife and I groaned a bit but thought we would figure things out after a few weeks. Sorry to report that it’s just a step backwards. It might be great for a user with 1 speaker, but it’s horrible for more than that. Sorry.  Stopping music in a room. Grouping rooms. Switching music from one room to another. All of these things were simple 1-2 clicks before. We still struggle with these common cases after weeks with the new UX. Just not intuitive. Maybe it looks better to some so keep the colors but rollback the experience. Please.

title: Not Worth It
text:
You cannot use the music you have on your iPhone, you have to pay for a subscription. Wasn’t always the case. I’ve spent hundreds and hundreds of dollars for songs and cannot play them on Sonos without having to pay for a subscription. Sonos speakers sound great, and they are also very expensive. For the money I’ve spent on speakers I don’t feel like I should have to pay for Apple Music to play music I’ve already paid for. My buddy has Bose they are equally expensive but way more user friendly. My advice for iPhone users that don’t have Apple Music, go a different route. 

Last update the app won’t even open.... super frustrating. I now have 3 play 1 speakers, a sound bar, and a sub that are useless.

title: Loved it til you took options away
text:
I used my sonos speakers to listen to my already paid for Apple Tunes, Audible books, and my favorite podcasts while I worked. Now I can listen to the music I have already paid for, instead I have to pay more for an Apple subscription. Absolutely not! I have already paid hundreds for all the music I own! And not being able to listen to my podcasts anymore is just a double whammy. My husband is a low voltage installer and dealer and will no longer be selling this product to customers, and is replacing it for us with another system.

title: Amazing sound system, pretty darn good app.
text: Owner of 11 Play 1's, 2 Play 5’s, 2 Sound bars, 2 subs, and a Boost here. I'm blown away by the sound and versatility of this amazing whole-house system. However, Sonos has had a couple of big stumbles lately. First, the new version of the app is horrible. The UI is much harder to navigate than the last version, and it really fragments the experience of attempting whole house music. Second, the beta release with Amazon’s Alexa is completely non-functional. You lose the whole house experience with no ability to group speakers, and Alexa’s control over the Sonos speakers is ridiculously bad, constantly resulting in errors. I’m desperately waiting for Sonos to get things together.

title: Nice idea, needs improvement
text: It's a neat concept, but I think there are still bugs to work out.  For one, it takes FOREVER to change radio stations.  It is not intuitive to switch between the queue and the radio stations.  Rather than loading up songs into the queue, it would be nice to just be able to play them from one's iPhone/IPad/IPod app, rather than have to load them into the queue multiple times.  I like that one can control multiple sets of speakers from one device.  Also, WHY does it just stop playing music for no reason?  Ugh.  Should just get some speakers to attach to my iPod and be done with it.

title: Could use work
text: I’ve been using this app since very early versions, but I’ve noticed in these last couple that you’re no longer able to edit songs. When I want to move a song in my playlist I’ve found that it isn’t possible to. You either have to delete the song and play a different song, then press add next, which is an incredibly big hassle for an app that has so far made me very happy. If it wouldn’t be too difficult I think this app would be greatly improved if an editing option would be implanted in the app.

title: Sonos removing support for expensive devices
text:
I would no longer recommend Sonos. My less-than-10-year-old, $400 device is scheduled to be depreciated and will not with alongside modern devices, starting in May 2020.

This means that the Sonos system will no longer function as advertised. I will not be able to use my line-in/line-out featured Connect in a multi-room configuration with other my Sonos speakers.

This is unacceptable in my opinion, due to the premium price of the product line. I will no longer be investing in any products that combine expensive hifi hardware with cloud dependent software, as this perfectly good the hardware can be rendered useless at the snap of a finger by the company executives, just like Sonos has done here.

title: UI gets better with each update
text:
I’ll admit, the 7.3 update with a complete overhaul of the app threw me off for a bit. It was a huge change and took a minute to get used to. With each update, Sonos has been incorporating user feedback and fine tuning the app and working out the kinks. 

The only thing I’d like to see in the app is a full night/dark mode. The darkened now playing screen is a great step, but even with my display at the lowest brightness setting possible the rest of the app blinds me late at night.

title: Great, but
text: Let me just start by saying I LOVE our new system...two 5s, one Beam, two 1s. The sound is really very nice. Beam transformed our home movie viewing, this new size is perfect for our “small” viewing room. Set up was a breeze and we were listening to tunes in 15-20 minutes, from out of the box. My one issue is that the Sonos app will often close during selections (room configuration, music source, songs)and require us to go back to a home screen, re-access the app and cycle through the various selections to get back to where we were. That is annoying.

title: Great support
text: I wasn’t able to add and connect to my streaming services after a recent update. After posting a review about the issue, I was contacted by tech support to contact them through Facebook messenger. Tech support suggested an online update through the app’s settings and this fixed the issue. I love Sonos products and am glad that this issue got resolved. It can be frustrating when things are not working well but the important thing is that there is good support to resolve the issues.

title: Great app, a few recommendations
text: The app overall works great, easy to control and convenient having all your music in one place. The speakers themselves are top quality. The only additions I would like to see to the app is a night mode option, a full scale equalizer, and to ensure every time I’m playing music on the app the song is in my control center so I can control it at any time, as sometimes it glitches out and isn’t in my control center, so i then have to go into the app to skip a song.

title: Garbage User Interface
text: Sonos is an amazing product. However, their new app UI is complicated for the sake of being complicated. It is so convoluted and backwards that now I get calls from my parents asking how to change zones and turn on the music on the sonos system they've had for over 6 years(they used it with ease for the first several years after I installed it for them). The original UI was simple and easy to navigate, even for the elderly. Now, it is just a garbage fire. Get it together Sonos.

title: What did you do in the update???
text: We have used the Sonos system for several years. Simplified our life except this last system update has created havoc!!! For some reason it either does not recognize speaker changes or is very very slow to respond. I hear my music playing in correct room yet the app tells me it’s in another. Forget tv sound management. My husband thru his phone at the tv last night LOL! We adjusted sound by manually going to speaker. I wish I could uninstall the update.

title: Getting better w every release
text:
Had some probes when I first got the system a year ago, but it's a lot better.  My older review is below
-----
If you change anything you're in for some frustration. . .
Setup is a bit tedious to begin with, but f you change anything, you're in for some frustration.  It's so "easy" to set up, you can't change anything once it's worked before.  You need to add shares from your desk-or-laptop in order to get "your" music.  Also, even though The Playbar costs a small fortune, you cannot control the volume of your TV from your TV anymore--because you can't liar the Sonos app on it.  Also it's crashed s couple of times.  Not just the apps, but the speakers.  Then, a "reboot" helps. But the services are pretty good, it's just odd that once you fire up (from your phone or desktop) something like, say, Pandora, you've fired it up from one of your Sonos speakers--a different concept.  But that's why you can then fire up Sonos from another machine, and then not only see what's playing, but take control.
—-update 1/8/18 Sonos changed their license.
It’s much more onerous now.

title: New app is a disaster relative to previous versions
text:
We have had a 7 speaker Sonos system for last five years. Three rooms (Groups), updated software on both iPhone and Sonos app. Have loved it for most of our ownership. 

The last few updates from Sonos have been increasingly challenging. What used to be a simple and problem free experience when trying to use the Sonos hardware is now a nightmare. Phone freezes half the time, Sonos app constantly demanding update even tho it’s the latest version. Almost impossible to operate Sonos in normal manner without spending five minutes repeating the same steps over and over until the system works as desired. 

New app is full of bugs with iPhone 6s. Latest Sonos app update installed. OS 11.2 installed. Also logic to play music in different Groups is overly complex, especially in relationship to previous versions of app. 

Overall, still like the hardware and think it’s a good system, but the app has taken a turn into nightmare land. What used to be great is now a POS. Would look for a different system if I was in the market for wireless speakers due to the app.

title: Meh...
text:
Sometimes the app doesn’t recognize my internet connection and I have to wait long periods of time for it to either turn on...or if it’s already playing then I have to wait for the controls to come up so I can turn it off or change songs or volume.  

Most annoying is that I’m constantly having to re set up one or both of the speakers as though it’s a new system.  

I miss how old analogue stereos just worked when you plugged them in and hit a button.  No fuss no muss.

title: v8 feels like a step backwards
text:
I don’t find the user interface to be as intuitive as the previous version. The home buttons are nice, but options sliding up/down and to the side are not as obvious and intuitive as they should be.

A lot could be done to make the interface look more pleasing. The stark white is overbearing, it feels like my eyes are being burned when I open the interface at night.  Blurring the album art as the background would be a fairly easy solution. A ‘dark’ mode would also be a nice option.

I guess ‘functional’ word be fair description of the App. Really, I would expect better from Sonos.

title: Was amazing until it wasn’t.
text: The latest update really has screwed the pooch. So much so that tomorrow I will have $2500 worth of Sonos equipment on eBay. They removed the ability for one to simply play music from their iOS device. Previously one had the ability to select “play music on this on this device” and bam! There is was. Now that is not possible. What is possible is loading your music on to a server somewhere then having it connect to Sonos or get a NAS drive or subscription to some Apple thing. Complicated, complicated, complicated. The best thing of all about Sonos was that it sounded great and was NOT COMPLICATED. Seems Sonos is going the way of all ground-breaking tech; from initially near perfect to speeding toward sucksville. It was fun while it lasted.

title: Great system until you have to update
text: I’ve had my system for over a year now. I have updated it numerous times. The only thing is after every update the system is screwed up for several days. Even after rebooting all device multiple times. It’s extremely evident that their software engineers aren’t competent enough or they don’t completely vet the app before they release it. Being an engineer myself this is very disheartening. So moral of the story DON’T ever update and you’ll be fine..

title: Still growing...
text:
Been adding to our Sonos system for nearly a year now. Now with 3 rooms covered and planning to buy the Sonos Playbar next. Amazed at the quality of the product and simplicity of use. Nearly as great as AirPlay, but I get nearly all of that functionality in every room by connecting to just one Airport.

Edit: just updated to version 8.0. I don’t like it. It’s harder to navigate and find the favorites and music I want to play. I also prefer the old, black interface vs the new, white one.

title: Alexa
text: I’ve read several complaints about this, so I’m hoping this is the next “fix” Sonos is working on. I recently purchased two Sonos ones, and while it did work for the first couple of weeks, I cannot get Alexa to play music from them anymore. Funny enough my ecobee 4 will play music from it. She keeps saying I need to add them in the app; which I’ve done. Pretty frustrating considering these cost more than the Play 1, which honestly worked just fine. Overall I love Sonos quality and would recommend them to anyone. I simply want what I paid for.

title: Lots of potential!!
text: The sound quality is absolutely exquisite, but everything else is just meh... Thus the 1 star is all for exceptional sound. App needs lots of work for integration and categorization of personal music library, like sorting by date added, artist, genre and so forth. Also, would love to see extensions for audio support outside the app to cover audio from any source. Set-up is really faulty, half the time the app randomly disconnects from the music source, and you can’t set alarms from a mobile device (which is more likely to remain connected to your network) only a computer (consumes a lot of power to remain on when I’m sleeping). Nice vision for wireless audio, tremendously flawed execution dependent on way too many outside factors.

title: Sonos Rules (now it’s a mess)
text:
We've probably had Sonos equipment for nearly ten years. Over time it has taken over the whole house.  It simply works, and works simply. Oh, and the sound is excellent!  And they keep adding new improvements that blend in seamlessly, from subs and sound bars to straightforward apps. Now with the ease of controlling great sound from myriad sources all over the house with a cell phone or tablet, the convenience and versatility can't be beat.  We heartily endorse Sonos!

Nov 2017 update: Rrrrr. The new controller app for ipad is hopelessly horrible. Really. Just completely a mess. Equipment is 5 star; software is now a 0 star. Unfortunately the software is the gateway to using the equipment, thus spoiling the entire Sonos experience. Very frustrating. Very disappointing.

title: If you like crying you’ll love the new Sonos app!
text: This is probably the second review I have written in the past 8 years, and the other was for an app I helped make. This app is heartbreaking - it cannot be navigated or used by human beings. I would describe the UI as “78 year old trying to use Snap Chat” if this were just a free app it wouldn’t be a big deal. Unfortunately I have invested in thousands and thousands of dollars of Sonos speakers so this new twist of “not being able to use them ever” is a bit challenging. I love music and unfortunately this new app takes it away from me. Hope they’ll listen to feedback or even try to use it themselves. Full disclosure: prior to the new app I have been hands down 5 out of 5 on Sonos. It’s amazing. But not right now.

title: STILL not working for me
text: I’ve spoken to tech support, I’ve changed ISP, and I’ve always updated to the most current software. It still skips and I get a prompt for “unable to play song” I can’t believe I spent so much money on modern speakers and can’t listen to my music the way intended. Every time I play music from my own device it skips. EVERY TIME. Tech support pretty much said to get a new phone. But, when I play my music using Airplay everything works perfectly fine. That tells me it’s the app. Fix your app!

title: Good, but inconvenient
text:
The sound quality of the speaker itself is great. It adjusts depending on the acoustics of the room and fills any space well.

The app, on the other hand, is tricky to navigate and unintuitive. It took me a long time to understand how to access all of the different features. My biggest complaint is that without an excellent wi-fi connection, the speaker is unusable. I would love if the speaker had a Bluetooth-only or USB option.

Ultimately, the speaker is good, but buy with the knowledge that it will be staying mostly in one place, and is only as good as your wifi.

title: Pathetic software
text:
Been a sonos customer for years; have multiple speakers, dock, bridge and been through various versions of the controller app.
Have to say things are getting worse not better. Don't get me wrong, the hardware is fantastic; but it's not much use if the app keeps crashing or being unresponsive. Radio integration is also diabolical, despite constant claims to be working on it. Starts to sound like tired excuses. Hire software developers who know what they're doing already!
Starting to wonder whether it’s intentional so as to get people to dump their old hardware for new. Try setting up your existing equipment on a new router, I dare you. Actually don’t, wouldn’t wish it on anyone. Days spent in setup purgatory!

title: Disappointed and dissatisfied!
text:
We WERE huge fans of Sonos and installed it in both our homes. After the update several months ago it all changed and since then we have been very dissatisfied.  We will shortly discontinue use. It was perfectly organized to fill our homes with the music that we wanted to hear when we wanted to enjoy it. Sonos is now filled with commercials and difficult to find the genre and mood of music that we are searching for. We paid for the service... why are we subjected to your annoying adds? Why did you change the format??
It was anything but a improvement.
Timothy Pope

title: Great system when it works.
text:
Have had my Sonos system for close to 4 years now. Running 4 speakers (of various sizes) throughout the house & I like the sound quality. The convenience is great like most any other bluetooth & WiFi enabled setups as well. 

My criticism is that music cuts-out or stops half way through songs, despite a strong Internet connection; especially when playing tracks from my catalogue (versus a streaming service). The ability to play from a playlist on mobile devices is also going away, which really dilutes the reasons why I bought the Sonos system in the first place.

title: It’s been a nightmare...
text: Have not had it working in a year plus. Hundreds of correspondences and calls with Sonos. Continually skipping songs and losing connections.   Many software issues and cannot have apple airplay in any other component in your system. I have 6 speakers, boost, and a connect, and have tried everything and like many others I still have ongoing issues. If you have many WiFi connections, AirPlay, and want a great system in your high end system I would suggest something else. They have no solutions other than turning of my other ‘smart’ AV components/receivers/TVs and that does not work either.   Very frustrating and I have thousands into this system.

title: Great app... here’s a suggestion.
text:
I love the app. Truly sets your speaker system apart from all others.  However, I love your alarm feature on the app, but I REALLY wish you would add more features to it. For example, the simple ability to choose what days of the week an alarm be set for would be great. (I.E. I don’t get you at the same time on a Mon-Fri as I would on a Sunday.) The ability to have the alarm NOT go off at 5:30am on Sunday morning, while having that as my default for Mon-Fri would be much welcome. 

Thank you.

title: If it ain’t broke...
text: Latest update claims to improve sound quality of Playbase... wait, what?!?  What exactly was wrong with the sound quality that warranted monkeying with it?  I hesitantly updated my Sonos system to v8.6 and and am very disappointed with the “improved” sound quality. Both audio and music now sound flat; the audio is lacking the depth and richness that I had prior to the update. I went through the Trueplay tuning process again as recommended in the app but to no avail. Too bad there is no way to roll back an update as I really liked they way my 5.1 system sounded prior to the latest system update.

title: Disappointing App
text: The first time I got annoyed with the app is when I realized some of the other options aren’t always available; for example, start station, add song to Sonos, or even playing straight through a group of songs that aren’t on a station won’t always be an option. I’ve updated the app multiple times over the past 6 months but one of the updates actually made the app worse, now songs on an artist page play as singles albums meaning you have to manually start the next song. Not all playlists from my Apple Music show up in the Sonos app either. Overall, I really just want it to be better because my actual Sonos sounds great.

title: The best home speaker system
text:
That said, some requests for the Dev team : updates that interrupt or block my listening at an opportune times, having to dig three levels down to find my podcasts, generally the separation between thingsOn my phone and all other things. Such as playlists in two different places. And most importantly the still unresolved bug with the proximity of a router close to the sound bar interrupting playback of things on my phone.

Other than that I love it!

title: Good system — but need more classical music options
text:
First, Sonos is a moderately complicated system,  but their customer support was of enormous help to me.  However, such support is only available on weekdays.

Also, they offer only a single streaming service for those of us interested in Classical music — one called Classical Archives, which has a lot of stuff but is miserably organized.  “Classical Primephonic” is infinitely better, and you would think Sonos would offer it as a second alternative.

title: Just about had it with Sonos
text: At a time when they face more competition than ever before, I've just about had it with the Sonos app. The hardware is great, but the software has never been more than average at absolute best. And this app is far removed from its best days, the latest "update" being the most infuriating of 2018. It seems to be a ploy to force the user to turn on automatic updates, as there appears to be no true update to install. Saying "no" to turning on automatic updates only takes one to the Sonos app on the iTunes store. Sonos would be wise to completely scrap their current software team and try something new before the whole company is relegated to the technology scrap heap along with other companies who couldn't evolve.

title: Drop beats not bombs
text:
WOW!! This system is amazing. We bundled the playbar, sub, and two Sonos 1’s. We have an open concept house and with the playbar and sub in the living room and a Sonos 1 in the kitchen we can fill the entire house with a quality sound while cooking and Netflix’n. The other Sonos 1 is in our bedroom which is great for the Alexa feature for our morning report of news, traffic, and weather. We also like to have the Alexa read books to us while we lay in bed. Best sound system I’ve ever owned.

Nice job Sonos

title: Okay interface
text: The Sonos speakers and sound bar sound incredible.  The interface/app is adequate but features/options are very limited when compared to iTunes.  And as for continuity, that's where you lose me.  At least once a day one or more of the speakers loses connection with the system and we have to go in and reconfigure.  Cable guy says it's because we don't have a perfect connection up here in Hollywood Hills.  Still, though, not enough of a drawback to dump the whole system.

title: What a crappy update!
text:
Whatever you have done to change things is a complete mess. Total fan until now..... I have constant connectivity issues the app stops playing continually I have to close the app reopen the app reconnecting music.
Now you want to use Pandora instead of your own app because you can’t seem to license the constant streaming and the services that I paid for through Pandora in order not to be interrupted you guys need to work this out and fast.
I can understand a few bumps in the road but this is a big one and I’m so displeased.
It doesn’t matter where I play my music it happens on the same service in different locations so this is it just a specific instance and as I’m speaking the music stopped.

title: Forcing A Change
text: They have updated this app, but those of us with old equipment can’t upgrade. And now this app is melting. So they’re giving us a choice: upgrade the equipment or stop using Sonos. I really hate it when a company does this. So when the app no longer functions at all, I’m moving to new equipment and getting my subscriptions through them. (Just a note: this app only works on my iPad now; it no longer works on my phone.)

title: Broken update
text:
The most recent update seems to have broken everything. Previously everything worked fairly well. Now the app is sluggish, half the time doesn't find my speakers or work play my music or podcasts. It's very frustrating.

Update: the app just sits on the opening screen when I'm using airplay.  Airplay functionality had been garbage from the beginning.  This app feels like it's been abandoned.  They want you to move to s2 and buy new products that work with that. I have all the speakers I need and have zero desire to spend hundreds of more dollars to upgrade something that isn't broken.

title: Happy with Sonos 1
text: I like SONOS 1 functionality ease of use.  Always happy to get improved features and functionality but in a new version but the way SONOS2 was launched was somewhat frustrating as it implied I needed to buy new upgraded speakers so they would be compatible with SONOS2.  This seems to be backward logic.  It then took an effort to reinstall SONOS1 just so I could keep using my existing SONOS speaker system (8 speakers) which I paid good money for and which all worked fine.

title: Best choice!
text: We installed an entire Sonos audio system as part of our whole house remodel. We wanted to be able to play audio throughout our home, as well as outdoors, and also a added 3 new TVs that required sound. Rather then incur the increased expense of in-ceiling speakers Kore MM solutions recommended we go with a Sonos speaker system throughout (also endorsed by my tech-savvy son) which also incorporated Alexa. We could not be happier and consider this one of the best parts of our remodel!

title: New update breaks the entire Sonos system
text: Cannot connect to any rooms in the house. Seems like a ploy to get people to upgrade to the new 500 dollar speakers. I don’t think Sonos has worked for longer than 2 consecutive weeks in my home in the last 5 years. Every update they push breaks something. Tremendous waste of money. Either Sonos is incompetent or incredibly greedy, either way no one should use them anymore. Just use regular Bluetooth speakers until a reputable company that actually makes listening to music through their speakers work properly comes along. Just lost a customer who was spending thousands on your garbage systems, congrats Sonos team keep up the good work!

title: Sonos will not support older products-shame on you
text: Sonos has pushed an update and included a message stating that they are renaming the app ‘Sonos s1.’ They will not support their older products, nor add new features for products purchased prior to May 2020. Sonos wants to push new products. That is okay, but I will never ever buy another Sonos product, nor recommend it to anyone. I have put those speakers on facebook marketplace. I will sell all of them. There are other great speakers out there- and other companies that treasure their loyal customers. Please don’t give Sonos a second chance, this is their nature- bait and switch, screw their loyal customers, and they frankly think we are all a bunch of idiots.

title: Stay away from Sonos, unless you like burning $$$
text: I put up with some of their awful changes in the past especially with them removing the ability to play music from a device. I should have trusted my gut and gotten out of this ecosystem then, but I stayed. Now Sonos is telling it’s customers that have spent thousands of dollars that some of their components they purchased less than just a few years ago will no longer be updated causing your house sound system to be split and not work with newer components. Speakers should NOT have a shelf life of only 2 years. Sonos has gotten progressively worse, but this just shows how awful they are. Do not buy these expensive bricks!

title: Seriously great system for a large home
text:
I currently have two speakers but am planning to get two more. My daughter and I can both be listening to our own music on different speakers from every device in the house including my laptop.  I use this system more than I used my old stereo systems of the past.

2018 update. I have purchased three more speakers and fill my entire home with perfectly synced music on a regular basis but can also target certain rooms if I choose.

title: Disconnects
text: I’m really getting tired of this app disconnecting and then sayings it’s my router or wifi settings that have changed. Nothing has changed, when I ask Google or Alexa if they are connected they still are, I’m still able to use the speakers via my voice but I cannot use it via the app until I unplug all the speakers and reset them to go back online again via ethernet cord. Like seriously? It’s this stupid app! Nothing else. The speakers work just fine! These speakers cost way too much money to have a crappy app messing things up all the time! I love this system but if this company can’t get better app developers then it makes everything garbage.

title: Too hard to fix
text:
When it’s working great, it is great. But that is how most things are.  When you need to fix something, the settings are lacking in any ability to do even the most basic things. Want to change your wireless network? No choices. Want to mange a specific speaker? That isn’t a thing. The measure of something’s greatness is how elegant it fails.  There is no resolving issues with these systems.  These are way too expensive to have to spend hours troubleshooting. There should be a “fix speaker” option in the settings. 

I currently need to change which wireless network these speakers are using. I’ll have to google and read forums to figure it out. Maybe I should just replace these with google.

title: Fed up with SONOS
text:
I ha e enjoyed this system and app for years. I have a speaker in my garage and one on my patio and things have been great for years. Recently, within the last 6-9 months the system has been driving me nuts. I use an iPhone or iPad to control everything. The music just stops playing through the speakers, look at the app and according to it the music is still playing. A song will just cut off in the middle and something else will start playing. It’s aggravating as hell and considering the high price I paid for everything I’m really ticked off with this company and the downward progress it has made in recent years. 
My bottom line to you, don’t waste your money on this overpriced piece of junk.

title: Everything I’d hoped for and more
text: As an early adopter, a person becomes accustomed to hit or miss products. I’ve been pining over a Sonos system for quite a while. However being an Apple fan and enthusiast I had to wait until apples new speaker came out. As disappointed as I was in the offering from Apple I have been overwhelmingly excited about the Sonos system. I don’t regret one penny I have to Sonos ones and a sub and a play five. As a musician and enthusiast and fan, Sonos is right there with my favorite band Rush.

title: No internet, no Sonos
text: Sonos is a great idea, and a great product, unfortunately the guys that make the software are limited. If you have problems in internet, the software does not work before every time you open Sonos ask for an update. That is ridiculous because you do not need internet to play a music in your playlist. I bought a complete system made setup, tested it and worked great, the moved to the mountain house where there is no internet and guess what. YOU CAN NOT USE IT!.  brought it back, updated and then tried again. Does not work because ask for update every time. Is it an Asian 16 year olds kid that makes the software?... Or an MIT guy that studied marketing... no idea, sure was not do e by same engineer that designed the hardware.

title: Love it when a product simplifies your life but makes an upgrade and messes it up
text:
Have tried various products over the years and this is the first one where I have been completely satisfied with it. The interface could be improved a bit to save favorites, set timers etc but am sure that will come over time. Keep it up  

That was my old review .... the new app upgrade is slick but not very user friendly and quite confusing. Make the app simpler to use and navigate please!

title: App needs a pro to redo it!
text: Need I say more? I, like other users who left feedback, love the Sonos system but come on! This app is not good. It's so hard to use. Queued list should have an icon at the bottom. You should easily be able to play or not play in various rooms. You should be able to control volume better. You really need to do a make over of this app so that us busy people who just want to easily listen to music don't need to attempt to master this non-intuitive app. Please? Pretty please?? Your high app ratings are for the system itself, which I agree with. If you isolate those reviews that relate to only the app you will find you have poor reviews. But you can turn that around Sonos people! Go Sonos! Fix, fix, fix! :)

title: Beam 5.1 system
text: I’m glad I spent the coin. So much easier to set up than a AV receiver and speakers. No drilling through hardwood floors, crawling under the house to route speaker wire for rear channels. Everything just worked right out of the box with amazing sound quality and everything is discretely hidden. If you have the means, don’t hesitate on this investment. You won’t be sorry. The sub is sooooo deep and clean I’m cheating on my audiophile stereo system playing music on this system.

title: Great system
text: Like many people, I started using Bluetooth speakers but, grew frustrated that I could not carry my music room to room without moving my portable speaker around. The Sonos system was easy to set-up and met my needs nearly perfectly. I started with a pair of play ones and now have a speaker in almost every room in my house. Rarely does electronic device meet expectations. This one exceeded them. The system is pricey but it’s money well spent.

title: Playbar, Sub, 2 Sonos Ones
text: Love the system.  Easy set-up, very good audio quality!  Only gripe thus far - the True Play tuning is probably a very good option for some customers and some speaker placements.  I wish that Sonos would also offer a real 10 band (or even a 5 band!) equalizer as part of their App. I find it frustrating that Sonos thinks that their algorithms can tune the frequency response better than I, the listener, can.  Are you listening, Sonos?  Other than that, excellent system and products!

title: Shameful App Update
text:
I have been buying Sonos speakers for a long time and have many of their speakers.  Also I have been purchasing music through Apple iTunes for more than 15 years.  
Because of this latest App update, I have thousands of songs on my devices that I can no longer play straight from my device through WiFi to my Sonos speakers.  IT’S NOT RIGHT that you give us the ability to play all of our music and then TAKE IT AWAY. Now we either have to buy another SONOS component to make this work or buy a music service!  NOT a happy customer here!!  
Thousands spent on SONOS speakers that are now useless, what a waste! Makes me want to get rid of it all.  SONOS we have been misled by you and you should think about customer loyalty.

title: Rebooting
text:
We have enjoyed to flexibility of Sonos through our home however being internet based rooms are dropped unexpectedly. We have to reboot the system more than often the rooms come back up, but have had several times that not all the rooms come back.
At this point we just wait a few days then reboot and back up  as it should be.
I am not sure what the remedy is but just wanted to post this. We have been using Sonos for 6 years now it does have glitches, but still enjoy the flexibility of music and room designations when everything is working as should be.

title: Horrible just let it be...
text: Why does sonos force you to use they're interface to play your music? Why can't I just play music directly to my speaker like I can with my Bose speaker? Honestly the interface is terrible, it always logs out of Apple Music, it never loads the playlists you play on the regular Apple Music app. Then even when you decide to give the app multiple opportunities, it fails time and time again. Logging into my Apple Music account to verify its me is annoying, it can't load my music library, it won't even list out the stations, then what CAN I play through it? I'm never buying Sonos again, only purchased it because I appreciated the ergonomic design, but I should have went with Bose. Never again.

title: Worked great until 9.3
text: My Sonos was great until I accepted the 9.3 update earlier this week.  I have the Sonos  Boost installed as well but the application occasionally states I have insufficient bandwidth, the speakers start / stop randomly, and the songs skip from one to the next randomly too. That said, I can stream 4K video to my Apple TV and other in home devices without issue and my speed test shows 180 mbps.  Honestly I’d hold off on Sonos purchases for the holidays until they fix their issues.   What a mess...

title: Something is amiss
text:
There is some sort of problem with the most recent update to the app.  After having near flawless performance previously, the app now routinely skips to the next song in the queue - before the song that’s playing finishes.  Not a good thing.

July Update: this issue is still not fixed.  Quite irritating.

Further update: After reviewing he suggested information re: router settings, the problem was resolved.  Thank you. I upped the app rating to reflect my renewed faith!
